Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dizzygirl77
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, fantasticly clean, cool but not pretencious. Fantasticly friendy and thoughtful staff with an excellent local knowledge. Before we went, people had warned me that Tenderloin was dodgey.... there are homeless people, but they don't beg like in European cities and I actually felt safe when walking around. The hotel is kind of on the edge of Tenderloin anyway, and near the Civic Centre which is a lovely open plaza. I would totally recommend staying here, and there is a Deli called 'Bread and Butter' 2 blocks up Polk st. that's lush and ideal for jet lag induced midnight feasts!

Reviews.Title: “So Rock'n'Roll...”
Reviews.Author: Ruby_RoxxUK
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Expect clean kitch rooms, great customer service and the Chambers across the way serves great cocktails and food. We saw two different tour buses parked up in the time we spent there proving this place is pure Rock'n'Roll. I will definitely return here when staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Super-hip”
Reviews.Author: Surferdude86
Reviews.Content: Even though the neighborhood is sketchy, The Pheonix itself is still a fun place to stay. The staff are always young, hip and friendly and the new bar/restaurant, Chambers, is still swanky. The upgrades to the pool area are also really cool. The pool itself must be heated because there was a father/son swimming about 7-8pm the night we stayed. The rooms themselves have also been touched up nicely. Overall The Pheonix will stay on my short list of places to stay in SF

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location, service”
Reviews.Author: j t
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with all the right features: character, cleanliness, excellent service, central location, and reasonable price. This is the go-to place anytime we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Monica S
Reviews.Content: My famiy recently spent a few days in San Francisco and stayed at The Phoenix. It was clean, fun & funky! The staff was extremly helpful and kind. My husband and I had drinks at the attached restaurant, Chambers, where our bartender was also very warm and helpful in helping us think of things to do while in SF. We didn't get a chance to eat at Chambers but the vibe was very cool and the food passing us looked delicious. It was also pretty busy for a Weds. night! Can't wait to come back. Side note-the area surrounding is pretty "gritty" and a bit of a shock to my small city kids.

Reviews.Title: “Overall average”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyBahama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Thur/Fri night. My wife and I were visiting for a wedding. We are fans of boutique type hotels and thought this suited us. It had a funky vibe and was in a location that we hadn't stayed in SF. The location ended up being great- walking distance from a lot. Got to explore Hayes St which is a neat area that I recommend to everybody. Neat hotel restaurant/bar on site. People were very helpful in helping us plan our days exploring different neighborhoods in the city. Overall, we thought the vibe and location were fantastic. The price was extremely reasonable. The down side were the rooms. They were extremely simple and dark. Not a place we wanted to go back and rest in midday and for that matter enjoy in the mornings either. It was unfortunate because everything else about the place suited us. Sat night we moved to the W for a similar rate- better room quality, location not as eccentric/interesting and not the uniqueness that you see with the boutiques. That being said the W was more comfortable for us.

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix - an oasis of retro in the 'Ten SF”
Reviews.Author: garyrussell118a
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Pheonix to commence our honeymoon fully signed up to the hotels R'nR reputation. Do not let that put you off. We are discerning travellers and we found the funky Phoenix to be a very effective and customer focussed hotel that would be enjoyed by many. Aestetically it is so different to many chains, its got a look of its own a heated pool and retro style Motel accomodation. It was clean, efficient and friendly, but most of all it was comfortable in its own skin, it didnt try toooooo hard to be cool. Yes the Tenderloin has its challenges but for experienced urbanites it should hold no fears, it aslo brilliantly located for hitting ALL the districts. Go there, fall into its very unforced vibe and enjoy The Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone, but brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: I'd echo all the words other reviewers have used for this hotel: fun, funky, friendly, surprising, cool. Basically, they've taken a classic 1960's Motel, decided not to screw with it too much, upgraded some key things, and then ensured that service is friendly, and that the bar / restaurant is buzzy and beautiful. What's not to like? I say this isn't for everyone, and here's what I mean: they clearly skew towards the fun / party end of things, with a positive encouragement towards bands and rock'n'roll visitors to stay there. Plus, the area, being close/in the Tenderloin would be off-putting for some folks. And the rooms, while spacious, and clean, are I think deliberately kinda low-key and "classic". They've kept the look and feel of the movie motel, while ensuring the right things are upgraded and modern to current standards. For me, that worked, and was complemented well by the staff, who were great, and very helpful. I liked the area (great Vietnamese food all around!, walking distance to centre of SF, etc.), and the bar restaurant is a real surprise - way cooler than you'd expect, delicious nibbles, and buzzing with a clearly local hipster crowd. I'd definitely stay again, either for business or pleasure. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Usual SF Stay ...Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is fun and funky with a terrific vibe. It has a very friendly and efficient staff, it's clean and is a great value. It was surprisingly quiet. Parking is free! It's an 'ironic' setting...vintage 60's (50's?) motor lodge in the middle of San Francisco. The pool is a cool centerpiece. Chambers is off-the-wall chic and a real gem. It's in the Tenderloin, which isn't for everyone, but it's near the Great American Music Hall, great Vietnamese restaurants & Polk Street. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ostara864
Reviews.Content: This is a cool, funky hotel that had everything I look for. We had a regular king room on the second floor, set back in a corner, with nice trees up against the balcony giving privacy. Very comfortable bed, spacious room, lots of "surfaces" to put your stuff on, awesome shower, good towels, extra blankets, heat that works (no AC, just a ceiling fan), lights that work and don't turn off on you, nice little soaps and shampoo, and a clean tropical style. Lots of magazines, a table and two chairs. The Wifi worked and the parking was free. Within one block there were lots of food choices. Cabs and buses right outside the door. The people in the office were nice and kicked back. The rooms are set around a really nice courtyard with a pool (warm enough for folks to swim in at night in the winter) with palm trees, water features, and art. Because the rooms are set back away from the road, there was no road noise. There is a restaurant ($$) and lounge along one side of the courtyard, and people sit outside. The lounge people party it up a bit, and there apparently was a wild time going on at night in the pool cabana, altho the motel warns you about keeping it quiet around the pool. Smokers have to go out in the parking lot. There are some street people in this area, but it wasn't bad. Old Saigon starts right on the corner, and you can walk up to Geary and VanNess where there are a lot of good food choices. Overall a nice location and convenient to most of the city. It was less expensive than the other Joie de Vivre hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with lots of free parking/internet”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: SF can be a killer with wifi/parking. Phoenix is great spot if you're spending a night or two in the city. It's nothing fancy but the connecting bar/restaurant is impressive. the free breakfast was awesome, but all good things come to an end and now you're left with free mini muffins and coffee. Overall, still one of our favorite places to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place and even cooler staff”
Reviews.Author: Kristi K
Reviews.Content: Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping to the staff at Chambers rock! ALL were very helpful and really cool. Can't say enough. The room was clean and comfortable and the courtyard was relaxing and fun. Chambers is a really nice place to hang out and have a night cap. Looking forward to going back to try the food. I will stay here everytime I come back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix Hotel in San Francisco is so coooool!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda D
Reviews.Content: The staff and housecleaning are amazing. Every morning you have wonderful coffee and an array of croissants, bagels ready to toast, assortment of sweet rolls, muffins, and good orange juice to choose from. Also, very cool that you actually have "real" half and half for your coffee. Additionally, the front office staff that I met, Blaire, Heather, and Luke were so accommodating and knowledgeable on where to go and how. Love love love Chambers restaurant right there for you amazing dining and drinking experience. The food is some of the best I have ever had anywhere here and in Europe. Just saying, and they are even in the works for some renovation which will make this place a definite place to stay. Well situated in the city, making any trip from there easy to get to easily.

Reviews.Title: “Family visit to experience all San Francisco has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: BERT56
Reviews.Content: The hotel we had tried to book was full so the Tripadvisor person recommended the Phoenix Hotel. It's not a 4 star hotel and has a more of a motel feel but it surprised us. We have two boys, 9 and 12 and they swam in the outdoor heated pool several times during our 2 day stay. We had three requirements as a family, pool for kids, free wi-fi and within walking distance of Union Square. We so enjoyed. A heads up that to walk to Union's Square, you will pass some shady characters and lines for soup kitchens. No one bothered us and it did open our eyes and that of our kids as to how really lucky we are. Really lucky. We saw the tree, enjoyed a late lunch in Jack Foleys and then took the 28 bus to Japantown. 99 cents stores are now 1.50 but we had fun. The staff at the Phoenix were awesome. Do ask about the controls for heating the room as we didn't and couldn't switch off during the night. Our mistake for not asking especially when the front desk made a call to ask if everything was okay once we got settled after half hour or so. Definitely will revisit ... we can hear the boys requesting already. More renovations in the works too so experience can only get better. Loved the free continental in the morning. Yogurt and/or cereal would add to the experience. Happy New Year and all the best in 2012 for the Phoenix! We're Irish and the biggest park in Europe is the Phoenix Park (located in Ireland) so we made a connection. Goodness, we have photos and we will try to add later.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the Phoenix, good location and place to leave the car off.”
Reviews.Author: Rer F
Reviews.Content: Stayed over holiday weekend, so my experience may not be typical (hotel was pretty empty). some really strong points: parking is free, motor lodge style (this is a revamped 50's motor court hotel) nice big rooms secure entry gated with key access, nice pool area and outdoor lounging spots if SF weather ever permits, that is... good central spot to explore on foot or bike tres helpful front desk folks - Luke went out of his way to help suggest jogging routes and food options one small sticking point: the cold! rooms are heated by one small wall unit, doesn't do a good job keeping up with room heating needs. BUT front desk will loan you a space heater, which warms things up and can be repositioned about the room. no heat to speak of in the bathroom 'though. think cold tile floors. I would stay again. good value when booked via joie de vivre web site, or hotels.com if available.

Reviews.Title: “Chic old school motor lodge, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: deadheadtraveler
Reviews.Content: yes this place takes me back a bit. this gem in the beginning of the tenderloin is a wonderful place to unwind and still be close, even IN the action. I agree with most of the positive comments posted here. I had the Headliner Suite for almost a week, and the only issue I had was the poor lighting in that room's fridge/microwave area. I truly couldn't see what I was doing. I guess that's why a flashlight is available in that room! maybe that's some kitzy way of the hotel, but I would have preferred better lighting...just saying. overall I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: maxitalk
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time staying here in October. Staff were extremely helpful, loved the location as it was a bit different. Lovely atmosphere, decor of rooms unusual. Very relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Cute!”
Reviews.Author: Christina B
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! Two thank you cards from the front desk staff were waiting for our arrival, one at the front desk and one inside the room, very nice. I think my happiest moment was noticing the recycle bin inside the room, how great! The pool was pretty and heated (didn't swim but I took note it was heated). The rooms had giant picture windows on the courtyard facing side but there were dark double drapes for privacy and sun protection. The breakfast was a tasty assemblage of bagels and danish, good coffee, ample dairy/non-dairy/soy coffee accompaniments, apples and oranges as well as some juice. I came back to review on tripadvisor because I was looking up the hotel's details again to book my next stay. You should totally stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fun n Friendly”
Reviews.Author: mistytravels
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in San Francisco. Reasonable rates. Friendly Staff. My husband and I stayed a superior king room. We loved the vibe. It's not the newest or most modern of the Joie de Vie choices, but the vibe is way cool and we loved hanging out in the courtyard by the pool. It has been remodeled and the modern hip style was cool. I was surprised and impressed by the complimentary breakfast. Grateful for the free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Boho flair with fab staff in the Tenderloin”
Reviews.Author: ZestyB
Reviews.Content: Really reasonable and close to lots of things. The rooms were bigger than expected, well-appointed and the staff was fab and friendly and just the right amount of arty. The breakfast part was also better than expected. I thought it'd be a lot noisier, but except for some folks rolling their carriers through at 1am on Saturday, it was pretty quiet overall. The only drawback is its Tenderloin location. While you get off at Civic Center, you walk through the Tenderloin to get to and from the hotel. I thought by now gentrification would've reached the area, but it is stubbornly holding onto its grottiness. Still, the location can't really be beat - it's pretty central, close to BART and busses and MUNI. And walking distance to a lot of places you may want to go. As the only trade off for staying there, it seemed well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rudolph_Wurlitzer
Reviews.Content: Virtually all the reviews below are reasonable. There is much to like about this motel, and some things not to like. Overall, it was a good experience. If you are a "suburban" person and not comfortable walking in a part of the city where you will encounter street people -- this is NOT a place for you. I never felt unsafe, however -- and liked the location -- near the Civic Center, City Hall, Symphony and Opera Houses, and not far from downtown. You are roughly four blocks from Market Street where there are a myriad of transportation choices whether your tastes run from Union Square to Castro Street. Our room was quiet, located at the far end of the motel from the lobby. And like everyone says, this place is a hip, nicely redone remodel of an old motel. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are clean except for the following maintenance issues. The lamp switch on the nightstand lamp was broken, and the tile grout in the tub was a little black with mold. These are things that management should remedy, and housekeeping should be trained to catch. The front desk staff was friendly, and even though it's not perfect -- I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Phunky Phun at the Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: dudemax
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Phoenix. It's good funky fun. I like the open courtyard/plaza area. The swimming pool is really cool. It has an Andy Warhol inspired design on the bottom. The artwork is so interesting that I was swimming down on the bottom to check it out up close. It's great to be in downtown San Francisco amongst all the high rise buildings sunning yourself by the swimming pool. The room was comfortable and I slept like a little baby on the soft mattress. The staff were all very nice.l Erica, from the front desk, was very welcoming. Angela, who did the continental breakfast buffet was great. She was very friendly ahd has a great smile. She did an outstanding job of keeping the buffet replenished. The Cont. breakfast buffet consisted of bagels, pastries, muffins, fruits, juices, coffee and tea. Best of all it was complimentary. Like they say, the neighborhood is gritty, but it didn't bother me. There's a lot of good Vietnamese restauants in the area it's the little Saigon area of San Francisco. The Phoenix is actually in a really good central location for getting around the city. The thing with San Francisco is that the nice areas are right next to the gritty areas. It's a very dense city. I took a great walk from the hotel. I went left on Eddy up to Van Ness and turned left. I walked by a bunch of cool buildings such as City Hall, The Opera House, the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium, the San Francisco Library and the Asian Art Museum. I proceeded down to Market street and headed left. The sights and sounds of downtonw San Francisco are good fun. The hustle, the bustle, the horns, the people, the buses, the trolleys are all great to look at. I walked all the way down Market stree to the Ferry building. From there I angled up through the Embarcadero and traversed Union Square. I walked up Suttler all the way to Larkin and turned left and ended up back at the hotel. I did not eat in the restuanrant but the menu looked good. I did have a drink in the bar. It seemed like a hip spot and it's popular with financial district people who go there for a drink after work. The Phoenix is supposed to cater to traveling rock and roll bands and I did see a van that was for a group, but it seemed like most of the guest were older in their fifties and sixties. The best thing about the Phoenix is that the parking is free. A shocker for San Francisco. Anyway, I hope to get back sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and different experience in SF”
Reviews.Author: Duckscribe
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Phoenix Hotel. I enjoyed the experience and I'd stay there again. It is an old motel that has been updated. It has the feel of a classic motor court, but with a lot of fun vibe to it. Here are the main things to know. The neighborhood is a little rough. I wasn't bothered by it, but I'm familiar with San Francisco and knew what to expect. If you prefer one of the fancier parts of SF, this isn't for you. But if you're not scared of making your way around the Tenderloin, for example, you won't be bothered by the neighborhood. Second, the motel offers free parking. This was one of my main reasons for picking it. Third, there are plenty of places nearby to eat. It's not as lush in that respect as some other parts of SF, but you won't starve. Besides, there's a restaurant on the premises. Fourth, the rooms were neat and clean, with large windows facing the courtyard. It gets noisy in the evening, when the hipster crowd arrives at the bar, but the noise quiets down promptly at about 11 p.m. and wasn't an issue. Fifth, the staff was friendly and helpful. No complaints there at all. Bottom line is that it was a fun, different place to stay in SF. The room rate was quite reasonable for a SF hotel. I'd not want to stay there if I had business in downtown or the financial district, or if I were attending a conference at one of the business hotels. I think I'd not want to to walk that far in business attire. But for my purposes it was perfect and a nice change from the skyscraper business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to San Francisco, I came to Trip Advisor and read the reviews for this hotel. Boy was I duped seemingly good rating! All these rave reviews are completely false I am afraid to report. This MOTEL (folks it is NOT a hotel) is a dump. The rooms have no air conditioning. The bed spreads were stained with God only knows what. They have tiny tube television sets mounted to the ceiling at strange angles. They all have louvered glass windows that cannot be shut completely. Which at first blush may not seem like an issue, however all rooms face an inner courtyard which contains a pool AND an array of speakers for the completely out-of-context ultra posh lounge/nightclub that leases space from the motel. Every night you get to enjoy the THUMP THUMP pounding of the music and cacophony of the bar patrons as the mingle in the courtyard until at least 1AM. That right folks, hope you didn't plan on sleeping. My room had a few other issues - the electric socket next to the bed was non-functioning. So no lamp within reach of the bed. And instead of fixing the issue the hotel just moved the alarm clock from the bedside table to a table on the far side of the room. (completely inconvenient). In addition, my key card stopped working THREE times during my 3 night stay. Each day I had to trek down to the front desk (there is no lobby btw, just a desk) and ask them for a new one. (The friendly maintenance man noticed my struggles and informed me that its a common issue, and the locks need to be cleaned better) The neighborhood is what i would call "sketchy". Cabs are scarce. And I did not feel safe walking around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Aprild44
Reviews.Content: Great stay at The Phoenix in SF. The location was central for our needs & the room was clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster haven, great value”
Reviews.Author: bneuf
Reviews.Content: Unique accommodation, unlike anything I've stayed at. Very "un-corporate", the staff treat you more like you are staying at their home. Very helpful but discreet. The pool was a hit in the hot weather, and not common in downtown SF at these rates. Free parking, wifi and bottle of wine on arrival sealed the deal. The attached lounge was very cool also; good music, expert drinks. I expected to hear loud music based on some other reviews from years ago but frankly didn't hear anything outside the lounge (would have enjoyed more music!) The location looks a bit rough but after a day or two you realize it is fine. A couple blocks from higher end hotels. Countless great restaurants within 1 or 2 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: CometFrogs_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 total nights. They accomodated several special requests without any problems. When we first arrived, we told the desk staff about what a hard day we had getting there. About 15 minutes after going to our room, someone arrived with a little gift basket to brighten up our day. There are several great restaurants within walking distance, and It's great to have a place to park our car in SF without paying 2 arms and legs.

Reviews.Title: “Different and fun”
Reviews.Author: fabienne p
Reviews.Content: It's a driving motel in the middle of San Francisco! It was a great experience and the staff was helpful and friendly. But you need to know that It'isnt the best location of San Francisco but practical - We had a good time!! The Chamber's is a bar/restaurant with a nice ambiance. If you are not difficult, try it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: firedog13814
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews about this hotel, I decided to give it a try. I was not disappointed, and enjoyed my stay very much. The room I requested was ready upon check-in and the front desk staff (Blair and Erika) were very friendly and helpful. True, the surrounding area is not a place where you would want to walk the streets after dark, but the hotel was very safe with good security inside the gates. The only negative thing I could say is that there was no refrigerator in my room, and for the price I paid ($186 on a Friday night), I would have expected that one small amenity. A more reasonable price would have been about $40 less, but then again it is San Francisco and rooms don't come cheap on weekends. All in all, I had a great stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Rock'n'Roll hotel delights and charms visitors from afar”
Reviews.Author: Jake E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August and again in early september. Great little hotel reminiscent of the drive-in motels you see in Mad Men. Great service from the check-in desk, and a good price, too. Great food and drinks from Chamber's bar next door. All in all, will be staying here again, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: MrJRKnight
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with nice room but the bar / restraint turns into a late night bar, and the smoking area / outside area for this is the patio that all rooms look onto which dose get noisy at weekends. And we was not told about this on checkin however it stops at 1am ish The rooms are tidy and nice and the place holds a lot of history. The location is ok but after dark it's a bit rough, they do provide a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Ellisario
Reviews.Content: I must admit that when we first arrived I had my reservations (no pun intended). The area is quite run down, and I wouldn't recommend walking around there at night. The hotel also resembles a 1960/70's motel (which it was) and at night (especially at the weekend) the hotel is very loud (reception give out free ear plugs). BUT, the place has a definite vibe, everyone is super friendly and it is a real bohemian gem. It's about 3 blocks up from the Civic Center, and to be honest the area actually looks worse than it really is. We had no problems, but if you're concerned the hotel staff can tell you the areas to stick to and to avoid. The resturant/bar is excellent. Get a reservation for the weekend, and settle yourself for some people watching. Top Tip 1: Take Mr Toad's classic car tour - it's awesome. Top Tip 2: Taxi's are unreliable and rude (even compared to NYC cabs)! They don't honour reservations (they'll pick up anyone that's there) and when you do get in the cab put you seatbelt on, say your prayers and hold on. Ask reception to order your cab, as they use reliable sources.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in a rock star hotel”
Reviews.Author: George K
Reviews.Content: I've pretty much spent more nights at the Phoenix over the past two years than most people spend at hotels in a lifetime. There is a reason I keep coming back: the amazing staff. Sure the central location is killer (right next to Saigon Sandwich!), the parking included (a bonus), and the new bar/resto (Chambers) serves up some delicious food. But it's the attention to detail and the friendliness of the staff that have me coming back to this Joie de Vivre establishment every time. It's not for everyone, but it's definitely a great place, at a great price. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, fair complimentary breakfast, maybe a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: alex_lochaber
Reviews.Content: A great three night stay. Only a couple of issues really: for the price we paid, the rooms were not good enough. Quite dated and the carpet wasn't great. BUT, it was very trendy and retro and clean so we were pretty happy. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the complimentary continental breakfast every morning was a bonus. On our last night however, mid-week, they had a TV screening for about 100 people in the pool/courtyard and that was VERY noisy. Would highly recommend the restaurant. Excelleng food and BRILLIANT vibe.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in SF”
Reviews.Author: pas0girl
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time we have stayed at Phoenix Hotel in San Francisco, but it was the first time we brought the kids! It was perfect. We were there mid-week for business so we did not encounter nighttime frolicking from the bar/club on premises. The kids loved the heated pool and the delicious breakfast pastries, the grown-ups loved the free parking and the potent coffee. I know this place has a reputation for being in the bad part of town, and that might be true, but we walked to restaurants and to the cable car stop at Market Street and felt fine about it. We passed some homeless people drinking in the street a few blocks from the hotel, but we just told the kids to stick close and we walked a little faster. All in all this is a great place to stay in SF. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tony L
Reviews.Content: We are a couple who have retired and have travelled the world extensively. We prefer places that give us more than just a place to stay for the night, a place that has that grin factor when you walk in the door. A place where the staff and people make you feel genuinely welcome in a friendly relaxed natural way but are still efficient. The room bed and bath room must be clean and the bed must be comfortable. We also look for a good breakfast. We like to get an experience of a City such San Francisco, warts an all. So we were able to walk this neighbourhood and get an impression of the culture in this area as well seeing things that are mainstream tourist places all for a reasonable price. The Phoenix ticked all the boxes for us.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY LOUD”
Reviews.Author: Kgari
Reviews.Content: The good parts- great staff, good size rooms. Now the rest. This hotel desperately needs to double glaze the rooms, to reduce strett noise. Sirens all night long. The noise on Saturady night from their disco is unbearable. I had people ringing me at 2 in the morning wanting to order a pizza. The area is full of homeless people and ex -crims. Bbetter value in other locales, I regret to say. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting alternative in SF”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Okay neighborhood. Great courtyard with pool area if the weather is nice. Terrific restaurant and bar. Room was large and well appointed, second balcony very nice, could have used an extra electrical outlet.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled out hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: Iloveholidays893
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our trip and we were amazed at how friendly everyone was. The staff were fantastic, very helpful with advice on the city, even compiling a list of bars they though we might like. The room was nice, we only dipped in the pool once for 10min as it was a little cold. The adjacent restaurant Chambers does great cocktails. The only drawback is the location, we had repeated warnings from different people not to walk around at night so we didn't, having said this I definitely felt very safe at the Phoenix Hotel. Overall a lovely relaxed hotel with a nice atmosphere to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan1122273
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nites and wished we could have stayed longer. The resturant was just remodeled and it was done with class. The bar also had a facelift and it was comfortable and cool. The staff was very helpful, made sure we had everthing we requested. Loved the pool, and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Retro hotel, free parking”
Reviews.Author: mojomiller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. Free parking was a great draw to this hotel. Rooms are big, clean, but can do with a paint in some places. Big bed. Shower ok, the light in the bathroom sometimes did not work but wait 5 minutes and it did. Location is ok, if you stand out as a tourist you may get hassled by the bums but just ignore them. Got to take part in a wine tasting event for free. Overall would defiantly recommend but don't expect the same luxury as the brand new Hilton it is as it describes a motor lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdcdd
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the Phoenix with my young adult daughters and we all loved the relaxed and casual atmosphere. Great staff, friendly and kind, outdoor breakfast under overhead heaters in early morning mist, early evening reading by the pool surrounded by city sounds and birdsong, and just a short walk from BART, Glide, cinemas and Union Square. Seriously unfussy and calm. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice pool, nice service”
Reviews.Author: Sangor1
Reviews.Content: Different (in positive way) from other hotels in vicinitY, helpful stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe; in the Tenderloin that's saying something!”
Reviews.Author: menilman
Reviews.Content: I just wrote a review for "Bed & Breakfast Antiche Mura" in Arezzo Italy and said that I had stayed in cleaner rooms in SF skid row. This was the place I was referring to. Growing up in the Bay Area and knowing to avoid the Tenderloin at night, I was skeptical when a friend recommended this place but our choices were limited at the last minute and we wanted to go to a show at the Warfield, so I crossed my fingers and hoped our car would survive the night. Not only did our car survive all night in the free parking lot (a big big plus for the Phoenix) but I felt very safe behind the gate to the hotel rooms that said "don't mess with us." The check-in people were very friendly and efficient, and the room was pretty clean, and the bathroom was really clean, all things considered. I had forgotten how drafty SF buildings are, and this was no exception. But having real glass glasses to drink from, free wifi and a "rock and roll" selection of reading material made up for any drawbacks. It's funny to turn on the TV and find it set to MTV instead of the usual CNN.

Reviews.Title: “Really fun Chambers restaurant and bar, lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: Jotripper
Reviews.Content: This isn't your typical hotel so don't come here expecting the ordinary. Our King Deluxe room was funky but clean and comfy, and painted in fun colors. The heated pool is a work of art and feels great once the fog burns off after touring all day. Chambers is quite chic with albums on the walls to spark conversations and trips down memory lane, and great food. They threw a wine party the 2nd night which was quite noisy, but we got to join in the party and it all ended by 10 pm so all was well. The noise really wasn't a problem. The neighborhood is full of sketchy people, but also plenty of tourists and nice locals. Hey, it's the Tenderloin. You want the ordinary, stay in Kansas. Parking spaces are narrow; don't show up in a big vehicle and expect easy parking.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, It's like stepping back into the 50's with internet”
Reviews.Author: cleetus_riva
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is the most unique place in SF that I have ever stayed in. It has a super cool vibe for folks who don't want the typical tourist stay in the city. The nightlife outside the hotel is sketchy but if you want to go somewhere else just take a cab. There is an amazing breakfast place I ate at around the corner called Brenda's and a good Vietnamese deli too.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelmountains
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel Pro's Nice atmosphere, friendly staf and good restaurants in the area, parking space Con's The area is somewhat less, two blocks away

Reviews.Title: “Great oasis in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Cpoulter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in October and had a ball. We were a family with a 2 year old and felt well accommodated for, safe and welcome. Having read the reviews here, once we arrived we asked for a map of the area at reception and how to get around. We also asked for an indication of where not to go. A no go area (fairly close to the hotel) was marked on our map and we stayed clear. Therefore we missed some of the dodgier side of the area mentioned here. The breakfast and coffee was amazing - our body clocks had not adjusted yet and we were always up early and really this was the best time for breakfast and an early start to our sightseeing day. The pool was clean and warm and a nice way to relax after a hard day's sightseeing. We walked to MAx's Opera Cafe one night which was filing food in a great atmospheric restaurant with opera singing waiting staff! We loved our stay and would definitely return if we were in that part of the world again - I hope we will be!

Reviews.Title: “Fun motel, close to family and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: bible_and_rifle
Reviews.Content: My experience was consistent with other reviews and that's why I selected it along with being within walking distance of my son's studio apartment. My only negative experience was with the Wi-fi. It did not work more often than it did. The staff was great, however, and called the ISP, found the problem and got wi-fi to the point where it worked more or less. Despite some of the other reviews, parking at the hotel was not difficult for the full-size pick-up (without dualies) I'd borrowed for this trip. The spaces are city-tight, but not impossible. My wife is staying in August, and I'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, serious noise problem”
Reviews.Author: Prentiz
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, which is a really nice building, quite centrally located. It isn't in the world's greatest area, but that wasn't a problem at all for us. The staff were really helpful and knowledgeable, with great advice on the area. However, the noise in the evenings from their bar/restaurant is massive. With all the rooms opening onto a shared courtyard, which is used by guests from the bar too, it was like trying to sleep in a nightclub until at least midnight, with the bass from the bar's sound system going onto at least 2am. It is a lovely hotel, but I fear I value my sleep too much to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The way a hotel ought to be”
Reviews.Author: LauraIsMyRealName
Reviews.Content: That's just it... it's not that there's anything so fancy about the place (except the pool... that is a wonderful luxury!). It's that the Phoenix feels like such a reasonable, comfortable place to be! Friendly, normal people (normal to me-- artists and musicians staff and frequent the place), a nice earthquake-safe-feeling low-profile building, a courtyard with some space to move around, combine to make this heart-of-the-city hotel feel like a small-town, old-fashioned roadside motel. The free parking lot makes getting around San Francisco easy, by just forgetting about the darned car, and walking or taking the Muni. Also, the price for our room was quite reasonable for in-town SF. I have only stayed at the Phoenix twice, but highly recommend it. (Actually, i don't know why i would want to promote this place, as it's hard enough to get a reservation-- but not at all times. Be advised... plan ahead... or if you just want to experience the mellow vibe, go at a low-occupancy time and enjoy the pool all by yourself after midnight!)

Reviews.Title: “Very welcome feeling in an interesting neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: HondaFitTraveler
Reviews.Content: We drove into the neighborhood around 5am, after a long car trip from Minneapolis, and were at first a bit nervous, as there were many homeless sleepers and other interesting characters in the streets. Once we checked into the hotel we felt better, as the front desk staff was very friendly and professional, and the hotel itself felt very welcoming, enclosed, comfortable, and secure. The room was charming, clean, comfortable, and decorated well. The central courtyard/pool area was aesthetically pleasing, the continental breakfast was good, and there was a very nice, relaxed feeling among guests and staff. Because we didn't have much time to see everything we wanted to see in San Francisco, we used our car more than we wanted to, and so we didn't get a real feel of walking around the neighborhood much. It's possible that evening walking would have been somewhat uncomfortable, and more so in that particular location than others. So, for out-of-town guests who want to do a lot of night walking, it's possible that this hotel wouldn't be a good place to stay unless you're completely comfortable with that. If we are fortunate enough to be able to return to San Francisco in the future, we would definitely check out this hotel again, as it was one of the best overall hotel experiences we've had. We initially chose it because of its convenient parking and in-city-location at a reasonable price. Ultimately we felt right at home there, and wished we could stay and live there for awhile--really!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place.”
Reviews.Author: MWynn13
Reviews.Content: From the outside, it looks a little rough around the edges, mainly because of the bumeriffic neighborhood, but don't be mislead- once you get past the security gate, the place is an oasis of stylish, Zenlike landscaping and interesting, colorful sculptures and mosaics. The rooms are plain but retro-modern, stylish and beachy, and the pool area was really inviting and relaxing. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the clientele was a nice mix of slightly boho families, European travelers, and well-mannered rock & rollers (the band X was staying there; I've known them for 30-odd years, so it was a nice surprise to run into them). The in-room guide to the immediate area, put together by the staff, was like a hotel version of Amoeba Records' Staff Picks. I can see very conservative people being put off by a few factors (neighborhood, hipsters, tattoos), but these are my people- nice folks, nobody was particularly rowdy. The continental breakfast by the pool was lovely, with a nice selection of bagels and muffins, coffees and teas, and fruit. Didn't get a chance to check out the new bar, but what I could see looked nice. I will definitely come back. Side note: I remember this place from when I was a kid- it was painted orange and yellow circus stripes, and was most certainly pretty disreputable... I see the old souvenir postcards proudly announce the availability of XXX movies in the rooms... anyhow, the place has been redone beautifully and they did a great job of working with the original 60s motel architecture and giving it a very different second life.

Reviews.Title: “a little oasis in a big city”
Reviews.Author: MashenkaV
Reviews.Content: I really loved this place... I've never been to San Francisco and this was a last minute road trip from Los Angeles for the weekend - but my husband had stayed here before and thought I would love this place. This place has an old-school motel vibe, but with a modern, funky, quirky feel to it. All the rooms face the pool and courtyard area. Check-in was simple and the staff were lovely - a great mix of chilled out, relaxed and chatty with fabulous efficiency. The rooms were kind of standard motel size (which, as a Brit abroad, always seem large to me)... and had a TV and DVD player, were simply but nicely furnished - and everything felt super-clean. I loved the heated outdoor pool area and patio (which I think had been recently redone), which was great to sit by in the early evening in the sun with a drink, it really did make it feel like an oasis in the middle of a lively city. Great choice of wines and gorgeous bar snacks - the Kobe beef sizzling thing rates as being one of the best things I have eaten and is to die for. All the staff seemed really happy, ready to chat with guests and suggest places to go in the city. In fact, I would say that I can't remember ever staying anywhere where the staff seemed so happy and ready to help their guests in such a genuine and relaxed way. My only very minor quibble - it's great that guests can swim in the pool late at night but it does mean that light sleepers may get a bit of rude awakening occasionally during the night. Personally, I slept right through the happy giggling... but my husband was woken up a bit. But he didn't seem that concerned, went straight back to sleep and still loves this place. The area isn't the poshest, but we walked to and from the hotel feeling safe and were waved at by some local characters - but I couldn't vouch whether I would wander around really late at night. Add in a bit of rock and roll heritage and it's pretty much perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL TOTALLY BE BACK !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephanieGomez
Reviews.Content: The Service was perfect!The staff was informative and friendly. All my questions and concerns were thier highest concern and dont get me started on the rooms! LOL they were all i wanted and more. I love the location and atmospere!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_Z_2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there over the Memorial Day Weekend. We are familiar with the SF area and knew the hotel was located in a "not-so-good" area of town. The area is specifically known as the Tenderloin. We chose the hotel because it had free parking & it offered a continental breakfast each am. The parking rates for staying in SF range from $30 to $58 a night. So there was a significant savings. Our room was clean, free Wi-Fi, comfortable bed, and quiet considering we were in a city. The hotel can be described as eclectic - early '70s motel style. What we liked the best was the restaurant/bar located on the hotel premises. It had re-opened the week we stayed there after some major rennovations. It was a early 30-ish crowd which made me & my husband the oldest ones in the bar. (We are both 59 yrs old) But everyone was great, the staff was friendly and the drinks reasonably priced. We just loved the atmosphere and the interesting crowd. I recommend this hotel for people who are familiar with the city. It is safe to walk around during the day but I would not recomment late night walks (after midnight) because there are alot of homless people in that area. Also, it is a short walk to public transportation (Market St.) and the SF City Civic Center. It is 3 blocks from the Asian Pacfic Museum. The hotel staff was great friendly, courteous & engaging. The rooms do not have a safe for valuables so the front desk kept my MacBook during the day. The housekeeping staff kept our room spotless. In fact, one staff member saw me walking in the rain and ran out with an umbrella to keep me from getting wet. What great service! We did not use the pool but it looked beautiful & it's heated. It is a great place to stay and reasonably priced. My husband & I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Retro Hotel in Little Sagion area”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We were going to a concert at the Great American Hall and the Phoenix Hotel was recommended to us. The hotel is retro from the old motels of the 60-70's. The rooms have been updated but it still has the retro feel. We are older, but most of the people who were staying at the hotel were younger. We can see why younger people like this hotel because it has a cool vibe along with being inexpensive. But no worries about having younger people there because it was NOT a party zone. There is free parking, which is a plus in SF. The staff was very friendly and helpful with a map, places to eat, etc. The hotel is in the Little Sagion area of SF. There are so many delicious inexpensive Vietnamese restaurants to walk to. We walked a few blocks to the Great American Hall. We felt safe while walking to and from the Hall later at night. If we need to stay in this area again, we will definitely stay at the Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “First time - best hotel experience to date!”
Reviews.Author: BrunoTravers
Reviews.Content: There is not a great deal to Phoenix Hotel, so I wouldn't recommend it to those who enjoy a lot of frills from their chosen hotel. But then I wouldn't recommend San Francisco to someone who wants to stay at their hotel! Having said that, a few beers by the pool every afternoon after a long day out was one of the highlights of an all-together amazing week in the city. The staff we're another highlight... a lot of character but zero attitude. Every single member of staff was really helpful and played a really big part in why we were able to enjoy the city as much as we did. The atmosphere there was very welcoming, relaxed, and comfortable. I really liked my king room as well. There's not much to say besides that it was pretty, airy, and very practical with plenty of furniture and what with the killer jet lag i was suffering form, it was well looked-forward-to!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: nurselissy
Reviews.Content: Staff are very helpful to any questions or needs you may have. I traveled alone with two small children and they always asked if I needed help. The continental breakfast was a great start to the morning, with good coffee, tea and bagels for me. While the kids had good muffins and danish. The rooms were very clean with enough room for a toddler to run around. Love the green attitude of the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and unique spot in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: enilorac22
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot, unique and fun. The rooms have a funky, beachy feel and you can feel the old vibe of the courtyard motel mixed with the new urban modern vibe of the (almost finished) renovation of the courtyard and lounge. It really felt like a little oasis in the city. It's not fancy, but it's clean and fun and the staff was great. I would definitely stay here again! While it's not necessarily in what is considered the best neighborhood, we found the location was so easily accessible and central to everything we wanted to do!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place, but under construction and some very rude staff...”
Reviews.Author: Chefdread
Reviews.Content: A very cool hotel- fun atmosphere, great art deco designs, and very clean. I would have given more points-however, the two major down falls are the construction going on all day (hard to relax by the pool listening to the loud drone of a drill), and while most of the staff has been very accommodating and kind, a young man at the front desk was extremely rude- had I not pre-paid for my room, I would have moved to another hotel. He was rude enough to ruin my stay here- and has caused me to seek recommendations for food, sights, etc elsewhere. A big disappointment for $150.00/night. No restaurant or bar on site either. Would have considered staying here again- but this being my first experience here- it is also my last. Shame...the property itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in SF”
Reviews.Author: jjNini
Reviews.Content: Needed place to stay when I purchased some tickets to Slims to see Boxer Rebellion. Looked all around for hotels close to the venue and took a chance on the Phoenix based on the great rates. Well, I couldn't be more pleased with our stay. Clean rooms, great service, FREE parking (yes!), and free cont. breakfast (great coffee and pastries/bagels). The surrounding area can be interesting (with the occasional sirens), but I never felt unsafe, and once inside the hotel, I felt secure. Can't wait till they gate the new Chambers Eat + Drink up and running!

Reviews.Title: “Rock and Roll hotel lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: chadmtx
Reviews.Content: I love the Phoenix Hotel!!! Its clean, its in a neighborhood where real people live and its safe. The area around the Phoenix may not be the place you want to walk alone late at night (I was more annoyed at being asked for money on every corner than anything else - but that's in every major city). The staff is knowledgable and friendly, the rooms are clean and the grounds are safe. Unless I'm required to stay in another part of town for some unforeseen reason, I will always stay at the Phoenix. Thank you staff at the Phoenix Hotel - you are the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Hotel in Town”
Reviews.Author: catmusickitty
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is definitely the coolest hotel in SF. I have stayed in a ton of them and honestly the room is more comfortable with the Clift without the douchebags in lobby. You got a pool and a bunch of bands around you and free parking, not to mention great Banh Mi across the street. If you are looking for a no frills, chill place to take a rest. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place with a friendly relaxed atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: darch66
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Pheonix hotel. It's in fact an old motel, one story, focused around a pool and courtyard which is being revamped. The rooms are totally comfortable with pleasing laid back decor. The staff is super friendly and really helpful with directions, suggestions... The continental breakfast is simple and does the trick...good coffee, bagels, fruit and juice. The only possible downside for some may be the neighborhood. There is a fairly large homeless population, which is sad, but we never felt threatened or in danger. And the staff steers you in the right direction to get to many close and convenient points of interest with no troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pheonix!”
Reviews.Author: karen_dodds
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, the staff were so friendly, welcoming and helpful and were brilliantly layed back. The beds were so comfy, both the room and the bathroom were spotless (so big thumbs up!). The only disappointment was the lack of restaurant and bar, the pictures of these looked brilliant but when we arrived we discovered that they were closed - I had really been looking forward to their much hyped Ginger Snap Cocktail. The area out with the hotel is not brilliant, but probably not any different from any other city. I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and never had any problems, the hotel is shaped like a donut with a courtyard in the middle and at night the gates are kept locked and there is a 24 hr reception so nobody dodgy (apart from the guests) can wander in during the night. It's only a 10 minute walk to Union Sq which we did with no problems during the day; at night we opted for taxi's. The pool area is well kept and the pool itself is heated so was used well into the (Saturday) night. Breakfast in the morning was excellent (despite the slowest toaster in the world - although I think its maybe trying to be just as layed back as everyone else seems to be). It was a little noisy on the Saturday night but this wouldn't put me off staying here again. Overall it was excellent value for money and a great stay. Favourite part was definately the Bamboo Xylophone; ROCK AND ROLL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Move it two blocks west...”
Reviews.Author: scottyinphx
Reviews.Content: I've always had an interest in staying in a JDV hotel. Based on price and value, I decided to book this one. I wasn't disappointed with the accommodations (although for being a JDV, it was very bare-bones and out of date) but the location is atrocious. This was exacerbated by the fact that we are walkers and chose to walk heading east on Eddy (don't do it!). Had we just stayed in the hotel and driven everywhere, it would have been just fine. And the value is terrific - parking, Wifi, light breakfast, and room for about $125/night. Now for the more enjoyable parts of our stay - the staff is fantastic. They were kind and very helpful and extremely prompt with service. The breakfast was okay - meager selection of pastries, bagels, and muffins with some fresh fruits and coffee...nothing special, but nice to start the day with. The beds were lovely and quite comfortable, and I never had any noise issues in the room. Overall, it was pleasant. But, since we are walkers/explorers, we will probably refrain from staying here again based on the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and fit our needs perfectly.”
Reviews.Author: unicorn52_1977
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on this hotel. From the outside it does not look that great, but once you enter it's a cute, retro motel (used to be an old motor lodge) and the rooms are cute and super clean. Also because I am an joy of life member so they left water in our room and a cute little card welcoming us..also a welcome phone call to make sure we were taken care of. They were doing construction on a new lounge which will be nice once complete. It was perfect for what we were looking for...nothing fancy, but cute and clean. Free parking is a bonus for the city too. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love Staying at The Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: 1Paloma
Reviews.Content: While the "Civic Center" location leaves something to be desired, I always return to The Phoenix. Friendly employees, laid-back, casual atmosphere, clean, bright & cheery rooms, interesting folks from across the globe, heated pool and a free continental breakfast and free parking make this hip boutique motel/hotel a great value and a fun time. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “This time room #51”
Reviews.Author: Neilly R
Reviews.Content: I stay here often. Not only a great value with parking and breakfast included, but it's a cool vintage property like an oasis in the midst of an urban environment. Outdoor heated pool too! How cool is that!

Reviews.Title: “The customer service was beyond excellent!”
Reviews.Author: LDiverLisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Phoenix over the New Year's holiday. We were a short walk from the Civic Center and the desk staff called cabs for us when we wanted to venture out and see the sights. The staff was the so nice, most helpful, and just all around fun. They answered all our questions, gave good advice on resturants in the area, etc. I would highly recommend a stay at The Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Show!!”
Reviews.Author: BlueLightRain85
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is located in the Tenderloin in SFO..it is NOT union square..The rooms are clean, large & reasonably priced. Great location, favorite of touring bands while in SFO.. We love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A place so great you don't want everyone to know about it.”
Reviews.Author: lbezezekoff
Reviews.Content: This place was great. I heard about it from friends because they offer a band discount to touring musicians but wasn't expecting it to be so nice. The rooms were cozy and the pool looked inviting-even in December. Loved that they offered a continental breakfast. The neighborhood is a bit rough around the edges but it was convenient to good restaurants, public transportation, and whatever else you need.

Reviews.Title: “My abs fave !! place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: surfstein
Reviews.Content: Even if I could afford much pricier hotels in SF, I'd still choose the extremely affordable Phoenix and recommend it to all, even those with much deeper pockets because it is such a special urban oasis. True, the surrounding neighborhood has a bit of street funk but that's part of real SF, and for all the times I've stayed at the Phoenix I've never encountered any problems as I walk to and from Bart stations and local museums and restaurants. Inside the hotel, one feels pampered by the staff, the spacious rooms, the lovely courtyard with the fine Continental breakfasts beside the Hockney-esque painted pool which offers such welcome dips. The whole atmosphere has a relaxed hip friendliness--what more could one want from an urban oasis! Try it--you'll be hooked on the Phoenix for every time you plan a trip to SF!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, such a shame about the location.”
Reviews.Author: Claire675
Reviews.Content: It was so easy to get to The Phoenix from SFO; just half an hour on The BART, followed by a 10 minute walk from the Civic Centre station... but it was a seriously unpleasant walk, in which the realisation of what people had written on TripAdvisor was in fact completely true. It would be an absolutely perfect hotel...if only it were 10 blocks South West. Check-in was a breeze and the staff behind the front desk were so nice for the duration of the stay, booking us taxis and generally being helpful. The room was clean and spacious with one of THE MOST comfortable beds I've ever slept in! The heated pool in the courtyard made it feel like your were in a little haven when eating the tasty continental breakfast in the morning... But as soon as you stepped out onto Eddy/Larkin you were often immediately confronted with the smell of weed, loads of homeless people and a handful of crazies. We even saw a couple of people smoking from a crack pipe on the street! After our first evening there we hoped things would be brighter in the morning. They weren't. Public transport out of there was great; Van Ness is only a couple of blocks away and another bus runs along Eddy towards Union Square. So, that was brilliant, apart from the intimidating circumstances to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, funky and fun”
Reviews.Author: jagreiner
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great vibe, very fresh and funky. The room was spacious and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It is centrally located and affordable for the city. If your looking for something a little different, then this is the place. We definitely plan on staying their again.

Reviews.Title: “Caring and unique”
Reviews.Author: mirandastirling
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend traveled to San Fran for his birthday and we stayed at the Phoenix. Right away we loved the place, it has more character then the website shows. It's a rocker hotel and we loved it! The room was great too. But what really made our stay special was we'd told the front desk upon checking in why we were there (birthday celebrations) and during our stay they brought up a gift for my friend! I basket with cheese and crackers, an umbrella (it was raining our whole stay), a cupcake with a candle and a balloon! We were stunned, we never thought they'd do that for us. It was really great! It made the difference between staying at a hotel where we were nameless or a hotel where they knew who was staying with them. They made some loyal customers out of already happy ones.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value with a Funky Edge”
Reviews.Author: BrianFromDC
Reviews.Content: Our fifth stay at The Phoenix, which says a lot about it. It's in a good location, the prices are very reasonable for SF, it's clean and pleasant and the staff is friendly. It's not a great neighborhood (but not bad either) located in Little Saigon (fabulous Asian restaurants). The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. Free breakfast of bagels and muffins and coffee. It's basically a 1960s style motel with some upgrades. We plan on staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “A funky and fun place”
Reviews.Author: thedavids
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly & helpful. The hotel itself was a throwback to the 60's with a great atmosphere. Our room was comfortable and had a very comfortable bed. Free wi-fi & breakfast, (and free parking) are hard things to find in San Francisco. We felt like we got a great value for a big city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great again, but needs to reopen bar/restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ChiRedFlyer
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews before we arrived for the HSB festival and was worried about snotty staff and the strictly enforced curfews. A few hours before check-in I called with some questions about room placement and the guy at the desk was very helpful. Later when I arrived, there were no problems. PROS-The room was on the first floor. The room was very clean, good toiletries and comfortable beds. -The heated pool is awesome. -Simple but cool decor -Great Staff ie. Shaving cream, coffee, directions, advise-all provided w/ a smile by both evening and graveyard shift -We had no trouble coming in after 1am and even sat by the pool talking for awhile w/ no problems. -The city bus picks up and drops off right in front of the hotel if you want to go to city center or anywhere else w/o taking cabs. Walking during day was okay, but at night it's not such a great neighborhood. -You're in the heart of Little Saigon which meant great Vietnamese food (but not many other options) -Great magazines to borrow in lobby CONS-Right now there is NO RESTAURANT or BAR available. It looked like they were gutting it to rehab but no other information available. Hopefully, they'll put in something besides an Asian restaurant and keep it open late. Open after hours for guests only would be great and still keep location secure.(ala Sunset Marquis bar w/ a Standard Hotel diner) Room got a little damp and chilly at night. Although there was a space heater, a wall/window unit would be preferable. For people looking to throw the television off the balcony into the pool, try being a little more original. If you don’t get why this place is still cool after all these years, then you don’t know squat.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: abster116
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such a great vibe, and has a wonderful location. The Andy Warhol pool is incredible, the rooms are cozy and the staff is very attentive and personable. I definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Drugs and prostitution !”
Reviews.Author: Elsie049
Reviews.Content: If your idea of an ideal hoilday spot is a drug and prostitute ridden area then this hotel is for you. If not then STAY CLEAR. I have never been anywhere with so many drug addicts wandering around at all times. The hotel itself was OK. It is set out on 2 floors around a swimming pool, resembling a motel. All the rooms face have very large windows which face the pool and despite the 'keep the noise low' policy they have (and request you to sign) there is little that can't be heard. On the plus side the rooms and public areas were clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the breakfast was more than adequate. For the money you pay the hotel is overpriced and definitely not worth it due to its location,.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in town "oasis"..”
Reviews.Author: Elle248
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is quite a gem! Excellent service...very friendly front desk staff. The rooms, while not elegant, are clean and of a good size. the inner coirtyard is just lovely.. a heated pool and a quiet setting. The morning complimentary breakfast is very nice and you can sit outside to enjoy it. All of the rooms surround the courtyard. The parking is also free. Again.. it is quite a nice "oasis.." We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice but left somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: antonyschn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, friendly staff (one who phoned to check my room was ok!), the room was nice with nice bed & good toileteries. The walls do appear thin & the whole frontage of the room is glass; neither of which caused us noise issues (and I'm fussy!) The area- I don't think it's any secret that this is an issue. I'm quite an experienced traveller & on a number of occasions was uncomfortable with scenes that I saw. In fairness I wasn't threatened, & these were at night and a few blocks away but were a little offputting!. If you turn left and left out of the hotel you are at the civic area & will be ok, but I would advise anyone who is concerned about this to look elsewhere (although it will cost...!) My biggest disappointment was that the pool was being refurbished & closed for my entire 5 day stay. I appreciate that this is possibly a 'one off' & needed doing but as the pool was a major 'tick box' for me, it would have been nice to know at the point of booking; or post booking that it would not be open. Reception staff were happy to give details of local public baths but this isn't at all what I wanted & did somewhat mar my once in a lifetime stay in San Fran (like going for a nice two course meal to be told at the end that there is no dessert....). (PS its a fab city- have fun!!)

Reviews.Title: “Fun decor, comfy rooms, excellent breakfast, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferSavage
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two teenagers. They loved the flavor of the Phoenix -- cool, artsy decor, a wildly painted pool ringed with sculptures and a surprisingly good continental breakfast. (I rarely bother with continental breakfasts as the quality of food is typically terrible. The Phoenix's was fantastic.) The rooms were spacious enough for us and a week's worth of luggage. Super clean, too. If you're squeamish about walking around the Tenderloin, do note, you're rather in the thick of it here. However, a few blocks away is the Civic Center, BART and I never felt unsafe. My husband and I ducked out to a bar in the evening, no problem. It's a little pricey for the location, but if you factor in the FREE parking, it works out pretty well. One drawback: It is the "Rock'n'Roll" hotel, so you can't complain about the late night party noise. Expect to keep rock'n'roll hours!

Reviews.Title: “A unique oasis of calm right in the midst of it all!”
Reviews.Author: Neilly R
Reviews.Content: This stylish hotel is nicely done but not at all stuffy or pretentious. How could it be located in the colorful Tenderloin district! The Phoenix has always been a comfortable oasis. Yet, right outside your door are multiple clubs and bars, restaurants, and every imaginable transit option available in San Francisco should you want to visit other districts. I am nervous about writing this review because I fear the secret will be out. Comfy and clean nicely appointed, tropical-like rooms around a sparkling swimming pool, convenient location, and with parking and breakfast included, the unique Phoenix Hotel is pretty hard to beat - shhhhh!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip digs, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: robert292
Reviews.Content: It was my boyfriends birthday; the staff were gracious, helping with the surprise and fulfilling my room request. They found and staged wine glasses,cake plates and forks in the room, along with the cake I had delivered, for our arrival. Pool is bathwater warm , and the design is very cool. Continental breakfast was served til 10 or 11am. big comfy bed and well appointed room and bathroom in general, quirky cool atmosphere. dug it.

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Hotel is the place to stay In San Franciso...”
Reviews.Author: gogogirl75
Reviews.Content: The staff is always awesome. And the location is great. There are lots of bars & restaurants within walking distance of the hotel... And there is always a good group of travelers staying there. Best of all, the parking is free...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ag78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in July and I have nothing but good things to say about this place. We received excellent customer service (especially from Luke, thanks!) and our room was really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Young Urban Traveler”
Reviews.Author: beehivebuzzz
Reviews.Content: I live just across the bay in Oakland. I stay at the Phoenix for all overnight special occasions I plan in San Francisco. The atmosphere is fun and energetic. The reception staff is friendly and efficient. The rooms are exceptionally clean and all of the furnishings and appliances are maintained and in perfect functioning order. The Phoenix is also an eco friendly hotel. Their continental breakfast is a gorgeous spread of hot coffee & tea, fruit juices, a wide assortment of bagels, pastries, and muffins. They even have fresh fruit like bananas and apples. The hotel is in the heart of the very colorful Tenderloin District. They allow for one parking space per room per night free of charge. This is truly a huge bonus as on-street parking can be quite hard to find in the neighborhood. The Tenderloin District has a ton to offer in the way of food and entertainment, but is also in close proximity to other great neighborhoods like Union Square, Hayes Valley, Soma and the Mission District. One last note...the only reason why I would not recommend the Phoenix to everyone I know is because I understand that there are people that may not be able to appreciate the flavor the Tenderloin District has to offer. Hence the word "young" in the title of my review & the three start rating for location. But for me the location is all part of the Phoenix's charm.

Reviews.Title: “Kitchsy Fabulous in the Tenderloin”
Reviews.Author: BreveCappuccino
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at the Phoenix. Needed an economical one-night stay in SF with fairly short notice. Used to work right down the street so I know the area and know NOT to wander at night. Don't. The hotel itself is cute and comfy, and I felt safe there. It's not a five-star hotel, so I didn't expect the moon, but the room was clean and kitcshy-cute, the staff is fabulous, the morning breakfast is tasty, parking is free (HUGE deal) and I appreciated the "curfew" on noise - heard some kids having fun in the pool, but everything stopped after 10pm. It was a nice place to call home and get some rest for my SF adventure. Not the best bed, but for one night it was just fine. Join the Joy of Life club for sure, the beverage that greets your arrival is a nice touch - mine was the split of Cab. I saw a nice mix of families and singles, heard lots of different languages, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “rock n roll”
Reviews.Author: ToddS666
Reviews.Content: cool place great food can walk to downtown in the heart of the tenderloin

Reviews.Title: “Location , Location Location....not so good.”
Reviews.Author: qtcanuckinca
Reviews.Content: The Hotel website was somewhat deceiving, really hyped it up. I was dissapointed it was not what I expected at all. The employees at desk were very helpful and tried to make us comfortable but I was alittle freaked out about the hotels surroundings, quite an eyeopener could be looked at as good for our kids or not.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and hip without any attitude.”
Reviews.Author: PUNKPR
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with very lovely, helpful people working the front desk and this set the tone for our stay. The rooms are not fancy but we had everything we needed. This is a fun hotel that captures the spirit of S.F., great pool, great people that work there, great place to stay. We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: tultrip
Reviews.Content: The location may seem daunting - the tenderloin - but it is only two blocks from Civic Center and within walking distance of most of the theatre activity. The exterior is tired, but the rooms are refreshingly decorated and the pool is lovely. Moderate amount of street noise during the night. The front desk staff was great and we were offered a free limo to and from dinner. Breakfast was a little skimpy and was served outdoors (under heaters) on a blustery day. Well worth the price for central San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: shuwei1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Phoenix for 6 nights w/a teenager & younger child. Overall we were delighted w/this small oasis in the middle of SF - cool decor, GREAT complimentary breakfast ( not the usual - we had bagels, croissants, delicious pastries from a local bakery, all under the heat lamps near the pool-heavenly!) heated pool and FREE parking. The desk staff were stellar in every way, directing us to resturants, attractions & even called us by name every time they saw us - very good customer service! The area is not the best but very close to CIVIC CTR, BART & the cable car staring point. Our only negative experience ( & it wasn't the hotels fault) was that a birthday party had been booked into the adjacent room & was very noisy. When the staff did ask them to leave at 11PM ( per the noise policy all guests are required to sign) the guests were not happy & were extrememely LOUD on their way past our door, even kicking it & banging on it. When we reported this to the staff, they were depply apologetic & made it up to us with a reasonable perk towards our next visit. Don't miss the Phoenix, its truly a wonderful vvalue for the $$$! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “liked it - but not for everybody”
Reviews.Author: traveler10011
Reviews.Content: the phoenix is definitely not for everyone - the hotel is in tenderloin which is a marginal area - walkable but not tourist friendly/clean/scenic, there are however great restaurants nearby, lots of local color in that area etc. the hotel has a funky appeal - redone 15 years ago and seemingly untouched since then - very cool and helpful front desk guys - rooms ok - no ac and kinda dated, old baths - they have new rules to keep the partiers quiet - did not have a problem but the place probably not good for light sleepers as u will hear city noises car alarms and people walking directly outside your door and open old fashioned glass windows overall if u know what u r getting into it should be ok - liked the offbeat vibe, easy parking, non tourist feel

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice area, but the hotel more than makes up for this”
Reviews.Author: nathan-rachel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the first thing i noticed was the area, it was a little rough! The hotel are well aware of this and will happily call you a cab and nowhere is too far from the hotel ($15 max taxi fare to pretty much anywhere that is touristy). The hotel is lovely, the rooms are spacious, clean and decorated beautifully. The hotel has free parking (which seems to be a rare thing in San Fran) and also complimentary breakfast which was pretty good. I really liked this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff SO Helpful!”
Reviews.Author: brandiroo
Reviews.Content: While recently traveling to San Fran, a city we have never been before, we got all the tips and advice we needed for an amazing adventure right from our own hotel! The front desk staff was very helpful in suggesting restaurants for us to try, and we would like to extend a special thanks to Luke, who was more than willing to suggest coffee shops and map out restaurant routes for us. Friendly hotel guests and staff made our experience truly tailored to what we were looking for. The central location of the swimming pool was nice, we had a few steps to take from our room before diving in. As much as we enjoyed relaxing in and around the pool with other guests, I could see how noise may be a factor for couples looking to really "get away" from that, mostly due to the smaller size of the hotel layout. Perhaps a second-floor room would suit quieter guests a little better. For us, mingling with other guests & hotel staff was a welcome activity that only added to the fun of our trip. The rooms were very clean, and we didn't have any disturbance while we slept in a bit.
