I appreciated the hand-painted art in the rooms, and the bright cheerfulness that was different than any black-and-white or over-the-top-outdated-floral themes of many other hotels I've visited. Thank you, Luke and Hotel Phoenix for accomodating us on a wonderful first trip. We will definately like to recommend you to anyone looking for a relaxing, clean, swanky hipster hotel within weekend clubbing budget. :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect with an exciting edge.”
Reviews.Author: koorb
Reviews.Content: loved the place. a warm welcome, a warm vibe and a warm pool - all in a fantastic convenient location. the streets are rough around the hotel but we all felt completely secure within. and to be honest, to me, the neighbourhood was no worse than that around the Clift hotel which is far more expensive and far less cool. do it!

Reviews.Title: “Our best kept secret.”
Reviews.Author: Kimsurly
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Phoenix since New Year's Eve 1991. I have had my bachelorette party here, met some amazing artists, danced, swam, drank and just plain had fun here. This is where I come to get away from the monotony of life. Yes, it is in the Tenderloin, No, we do not bring our 2 and 3 year old's here but will as they get older. No, we don’t walk around outside in the middle of the night, Yes, we walk to Market Street, BART and many other great places during the day. There are fun little bars and restaurants to be found. Cabs are easily accessible and the parking is perfect. The Phoenix is funky, fun and artistic just like the people who stay there. If you want soft, quite and cushy find another hotel. If want to experience San Francisco and appreciate art, music and positive energy~ this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place & people”
Reviews.Author: diamondlil15
Reviews.Content: We loved the room & courtyard. Everyone there was very helpful in our quest to see the city. Location was a little seedy but no problems, great security. Trendy resturants around the corner, car rentals close by if needed. I would stay at any of these hotels after this & look forward to checking out other locations. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud weekend nights.”
Reviews.Author: timetogo5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 3 children in April on a Friday and Saturday night. The courtyard is great and the kids loved the pool. The staff was very helpful. The rooms could use some work, but were not terrible for the price which included parking & continental breakfast. The only downside was the on premises nightclub plays EXTREMELY loud music until 2:30am. It is so loud in the rooms that even with the windows shut I could understand clearly everything the DJ said. My kids slept through it thankfully. The brochure says there may be noise until 11:00pm, which I was prepared for. It wasn't until 3:30am until all the partiers quieted down. There were some other guests yelling for them to be quiet. Maybe weekday stays are better.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem.”
Reviews.Author: ClayNJ
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is a cool, funky little hotel in the heart of the city. Comfortable, clean, attractive, affordable rooms; unique art in the lovely courtyard; walking distance to downtown and the waterfront. The only off note was the restaurant Bambuddha Lounge, which I've learned is closing.

Reviews.Title: “Little oasis”
Reviews.Author: Jules63
Reviews.Content: Spent almost a week here in April. The neighbourhood is off the beaten track but if you're already a city dweller, there's nothing around this hotel that you haven't seen at home. Never felt unsafe, be it day or night. The Phoenix is a funky little place, right out of the 50s, with lots of attention to detail. What attracted us was the size and the accessibility to all the hoods in San Fran and we were not disappointed. Public transportation is nearby and you're not in the middle of the touristy Wharf section of town. The fact that all the rooms are off a central courtyard does lend itself to more noise in the late evening hours but nothing ear plugs, given away for free at the desk, could not take care of. We were not bothered by the noise from the courtyard although the thinness of the walls did lead to some interesting hypotheses about our neighbours' activities. The breakfast was OK but absolutely no variety in what was offered, which got stale after 3 days...The front desk staff were always super helpful with tips about places to eat, things to see and which bus to take to get there. Lots of great little Vietnamese restaurants to pick from, eat in or take out so we were never short of new dishes to try. All in all, a great hotel experience - excellent bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in S.F.”
Reviews.Author: boghos369
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Phoenix since 1999 and since then they have continued to make the hotel better and better every year. The location is perfect for me. I am just a walk or short cab ride from everything I need and want to do in the city. Since I drive into the city, I appreciate the free parking and the staff has a cab arrive to the hotel at any time I need one. There is not one thing I can say that is wrong with this hotel. Yes, it can get a little loud with the restaurant and bar on the weekend, but I don't understand why anyone would come to S.F. on the weekend and stay at such a happening place to go to bed early. For me, I want to stay at a smaller, more personnel hotel that has alot of character than a larger hotel that will be more difficult to get to and check in. Here, I can drive in,get checked in and in my room in minutes and get out into the city I love.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever. Loud music from lounge until 1 am.”
Reviews.Author: SleeplessMomInSF
Reviews.Content: Adjacent lounge hosts parties at night and plays loud music past midnight. We called the front desk but they could do little. We heard the bass constantly and just couldn't sleep. Bathroom is full of molds and it does not look sanitary at all. This motel is close to a hospital and sirens are clearly audible in the room. Funny when we checked in they made us sign a waiver that we would be fined for $100 if someone complained about noise from our room after 11 p.m. There are cleaner and quieter hotels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Tried it once that was good enough for me.”
Reviews.Author: CaliBlondie
Reviews.Content: If your looking for character this is the place It's different, 50's type trendy. Walls are thin. Neighborhood a bit dicey off the beaten path, but all & all we had a good stay. Front desk was always helpful. If your from out of state this is the rocker San Fan kind feel that you may enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, attentive staff, neighborhood a little dicey”
Reviews.Author: Roquemama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days because it was in the city with free parking. Saved over $100 that way. So, the hotel was cute and clean, the staff was very attentive, anything we asked for they brought quickly. They gave us directions and routes to keep us safe since this is an area in transition. It is right on a bus route that can take you to all the attractions that are too far to walk. The pool is heated, but during our trip it was too cold outside to swim. The breakfast was great. The coffee is nice and strong and the pastries were fresh and good quality. Nice selection of other items too, juice, tea, bagels and spreads, fruit, and hot cocoa too. It was nice to not have to find a place for breakfast. The WIFI was great, easy to log on and stay on, TV had many channels to choose from. We slept well here. In a bustling city like SF it is not easy but we had no problems here. The only reason we did not give 5 stars was because this neighborhood may not be for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: gladLA
Reviews.Content: we had a great time, nice outdoor area, nice people, bartender very nice, good staff I must say. good bed, very clean, good breakfast....

Reviews.Title: “This is a fine and funky place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2010Boulder
Reviews.Content: The main attraction for us was the free parking so centrally located in downtown SF. The famous restaurant which is part of the complex was closed the evening we were there, so that was a disappointment for us. Very friendly service and clean rooms and quite comfortable overall.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want Character and not Generic, Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: QFP
Reviews.Content: Booked three rooms for family March 21 - 22 for a trip to see King Tut Exhibit at DeYoung Museum. The highlight of our trip, even more so than the exhibit to me, was the stay at The Phoenix. Brought back memories of our early travels first years of our marriage. This place was a step back into the 70s and loved EVERY minute of it. The rooms were spotless, the staff the friendliest and most helpful and kind I've ever met in any hotel over the last 40 years and the atmosphere around the courtyard pool fantastic. Where else can you meet a band touring from Belgium, or someone married to a former drummer with a famous band. Majority of people staying were from all around the world for all different reasons. Spent the evening hearing about other's interesting lives in the comfortable heated patio area. Breakfast could have used a little more solid food such as cereal or oatmeal packets but coffee was awesome. Typical sweet roll, bagel fare. Pool warm and grandchild spent hours in there. Kids enjoyed it. Adults enjoyed it. Never felt threatened walking outside in groups. Not sure about alone? Hotel recommended a great "comfort food" restaurant "Tommys Joint" and it was perfect. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in SF now that we've found this jewel. On second thought....stay away. I want to be able to get a room next time we visit! Say hello to Luke when you stop in!

Reviews.Title: “Dollar for Dollar- location included- this is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: thebigear
Reviews.Content: A friend and I (both of whom used to live in San Francisco) recently spent a weekend at the Phoenix. I've been there previously for industry events and whatnot, so was already somewhat familiar with it. This was the first time I've actually stayed there. It was a great place to stay. Granted, we didn't have children, and we didn't spend much time at all in the room, but it was reasonable, clean and right in the center of town. Very easy to get everywhere, plus there's free parking. I've put friends from the midwest (smaller towns) there before, that came to visit for my wedding, and they all had a great time. They were a bit scared by the location though (which honestly only added to their enjoyment of SF). If you're not familiar with big cities this particular neighborhood can be a bit sketchy, but if you know how to act in a city you'll be fine. We never had a chance to eat at the Bambuddha, so i can't really comment on it. Overall, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a great value.”
Reviews.Author: NikkiNorthernCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Phoenix during a recent trip to San Francisco to attend a show at the War Memorial Opera House (within walking distance). The staff at the Phoenix is friendly and helpful, and they go out of their way to make you feel at home. The beds are comfortable and you can enjoy a continental breakfast in the 'artful' central courtyard. Truely unique; I'm looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, central, but edgy location”
Reviews.Author: fieldsendchris
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very large, modern and clean, with big comfy beds and excellent bathrooms. The staff are very friendly and helpful, although they can be a little forgetful so need nudging now and again! The rates are cheap for San Francisco and include a decent breakfast by the pool. The only slight downside to the hotel is the location, which is ideally place in the middle of all the neighbourhoods, but can be a little daunting.

Reviews.Title: “This place ROCKED!”
Reviews.Author: HHippiechick
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place and wish I could have had more time to enjoy it. I was in SF for 2 days training and 1 day to play, should have took 2. Staff were all super nice and helpful. Rooms were spacious and clean. Temperature got a little hot sometimes but just cracked the door which was nice to be able to do. I liked being able to open my door to the outside and stepping outside to smoke and being safe to do so. Other hotels you have to walk a ways. Really bummed the lounge was closed the 4 days I was there but not the hotels fault. I was a solo female traveler and had no problems near the hotel. If you are careful and do some good planning you will be fine. I was out late running around, fun stuff but I don't recommend for everyone. As for closeness to attractions, SF public transportation is amazing and this hotel is only 2 blocks from Van Ness, a major thorough fair and good restaurants. Love the Phoenix, it's staff and the price!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle114
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and a fun place to stay - I liked everything about it from the staff to the palm trees around the pool!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Weybridgewanderer
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap place to stay, this is it; free parking on the premises, light breakfast and rooms are large, clean and convenient. It's quite a long walk to the sites and you might not want to walk through the Tenderloin. The Buddha lounge is now closed most of the time. The breakfast consists of fruit, coffee, bagels and sweet rolls and is served in an outside covered area by the pool which can be rather cool and unpleasant. If the location were better I wouldn't mind staying here again since $109 is a great price but my wife would have other places in mind for sure. I did get free wif in the room

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind hotel...close to everything...totally different!”
Reviews.Author: 32Skipper
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Phoenix Hotel on the edge of San Francisco's tenderloin. I lived in San Francisco for 25 years, knew of the Phoenix when it was re-done, and have always wanted to stay there. I was NOT dissappointed in the hotel, the service, the comfortable rooms and certainly not the delicious breakfast (the bagels were the best). Staff was VERY friendly, the pool was heated and great for swimming (in January). This neighborhood is a bit gritty but we felt comfortable both day and night. I highly recommend the Hotel Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Rises,...”
Reviews.Author: RollingTravelers
Reviews.Content: From the phone call I made for the reservation to an early check-in, to a late check-out (all done with humility) the staff at the Phoenix couldn't have been more accommodating. Top notch. Room was clean, the Greeting Frog was a fitting visual to ring in the new year. Nice courtyard, clean bathrooms, comfortable beds, and centrally located. Worked perfectly for us.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this FUNKY OLD place!”
Reviews.Author: ladystephanie
Reviews.Content: When my partner made reservations in 2008 I wasn't sure about this place. When I got there, the room was decorated very 'tropical' and not much to my liking. HOWEVER, the staff was awesome and although this wasn't my first choice in 2008, it has now become my first choice - I just wish we had reasons to stay at the Phoenix more. The bed is one of the most comfortable I've EVER slept in, and the courtyard area is very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in the Civic Center area”
Reviews.Author: cbgb2
Reviews.Content: You may not want to stay in the Civic Center area but it's centrally located and if you're going to be in that area for music or select theatre locations you can't beat the Phoenix. I've stayed here many times and it feels fun, safe and great ambience.

Reviews.Title: “something you have to experience”
Reviews.Author: ErwinFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the Phoenix with a group of 40 "business industry friends". this is a rather different hotel...stayed in the past in hotels like Fairmont, Hungtington etc. and no way you can compare this hotel... it's true that the location isn't the best and probably also not the safest; I would recommend it for solo female travelers that like to do night walks, but I walked a couple of times there and had no problems. apart from that, the neighbourhood was quiet enough to get a decent sleep. the staff is very, very friendly. I checked in at 12 and my room was not ready yet. When I returned in the evening to check-in I got an upgrade to a King Suite. the room is probably more or less the same as when the hotel opened like 20 years ago. So let's call it vintage ;-). It was a large room, had most amenities except for a safe and for an A/C. So I guess on hot summer days, this might be a problem. Wifi is free but in my room (#61) it was sloooooow. there is a really affordable same day was/laundry service. the pool is small but great; they serve a free complimentary break-fast in the morning. (pastries, bagels, juice, coffee and tea, fruit) the bambuddhalounge is impressive and lively. so, it's one of these hotels you just have to try out; ideal for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: VineyardWoman
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the place online from the description and the photos. How can you NOT love a "Rock & Roll Hotel?" When I called to make my reservation, the woman whose name I'm sorry I don't remember enthusiastically shared some of the history and appeal of the hotel, which made me really look forward to my stay. Matt & Luke at the front desk were great! They supplied maps (complete with "safe routes," recommendations for places to go, drink, and eat, and even offered to "valet" our car since the parking lot was full. Very helpful and accommodating, and most importantly, they took pride in sharing their city with us. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and even had a microwave and mini-fridge! And free parking and free wi-fi, too! The courtyard is the star at this hotel, though...the pool, lush greenery, and cabanas set an inviting stage, and we enjoyed eating a nice continental breakfast outside on the heated patio. If you like ginger, you MUST go to the Bambuddha Lounge for the Ginger Snap cocktail - YUMMY! (Ask for it spicy!) I also like that the hotel gives back to the community, and even the nonprofit - H.E.A.R.: Hearing Education and Awareness for Rockers - fits the hotel motif! If you're a light sleeper or bothered by noise...bring some ear plugs, because the Rock & Roll hotel never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Rock n Roll hotel with a funky vibe - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jpstarshine
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in a rock n roll traveler book. I looked it up online and knew immediately that this is where we wanted to stay on our first trip to SanFrancisco. When we arrived, we were greeted kindly by Luke at the front desk, our room was ready and we walked through the eclectic courtyard with the great pool, plants, and sculptures. Another thing that we really loved is their commitiment to recycling and the green effort. It was evident everywhere and that made us feel good about staying there as well. Luke made a copy of the shows that were at nearby venues for us and we were in our room only for a few minutes when we got a call from him letting us know that there was a secret Weezer show a few blocks away in case we were interested. He sent us to Philz coffee shop a few blocks away - excellent - we returned several times during our stay. The breakfast in the morning was great and unexpected. We loved the eclectic surroundings and this reminded us of one of our favorite hotels in Austin, TX - the Austin Motel - same groovy vibe and fabulous staff and guests every time. We did run into a bit of the grittiness in the neighborhood. We knew about it and had intended to take a cab, but decided to start walking in the direction. We found a cab at just the right time and all could have been avoided if we had done what we originally intended. Things seemed just fine during the day. Just take a cab to and from at night and there will be no problems. If we are lucky enough to return to SanFrancisco again, we would look forward to hangin at the Phoenix once again and will recommend it to our friends who travel there.

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar Oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: sexyasscycles
Reviews.Content: After arriving a little early, ok, 3 hours early to check-in, I was still easily and happily accommodated into my standard room within 5 mins...it was the quickest check-in I have experienced yet in a hotel. Walking to the room, it's like you just walked into and island paradise, pool included!!! The room, while somewhat basic in furnishings, accompany the decor to the tee, and makes you feel very comfortably at home. And the staff? Well, they are the just plain amazing!!! I have not experienced a finer staff at a hotel, nor one that creates an atmosphere of happiness...or, "JOY". This hotel reflects their vision...Joie de Vivre. The neighborhood, although appearing on the rough side, is not, and offers so many great restaurants and shops and culture. Please treat yourself to this great little getaway in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: polarbear27
Reviews.Content: Booked above hotel did not know what to expect, but got a great surprise, not your usual, loved the area round the pool and breakfast outside in the morning, the rooms where funky, retro design and very comfertable, would have loved to try the resturant but closed for a private party (next time) plenty places to eat, recommend by hotel and staff in reception always helpful, what's not to like about San Francisco!! would recommend above hotel to friends and family, breath of fresh air!!

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel but terrible, terrible area”
Reviews.Author: Padrepio
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Stayed here for two nights in May when I was in town with friends for a concert. The staff were really friendly, laid back but very helpful. The rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean. The bathrooms were also very clean but could do with some modernisation. The bar by the pool is a great place to relax and have a drink too. The only downside is the area. It's very intimadating and full of prostitutes, drug dealers and homeless people. Thankfully a male friend travelled with me and if he wasn't with me I don't think I would have left the confines of the hotel and ventured out on to the scary Eddy Street!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pepperepper
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is a gem. It is small, clean, retro-modern, and super friendly in downtown SF. The location is an easy walk from the Civic Center, Asian Art Museum, Opera area, and parking is easy on-site, a great convenience and cost savings from most downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very friendly, Free WIFI and Parking”
Reviews.Author: thesraid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my girlfriend from Ireland. Lovely hotel. We rented a car and it is one of the few hotels we could find which has free parking and it is just a few minutes walk from Union Square. The staff are very friendly and gave us advice about what bars were good in the area. The free WIFI was great because as we were tourists it was great to be able to look things up on the iPhone without having to pay huge roaming charges. The area is full of homeless people but in fairness that seems to be common throughout San Francisco. They do leave you alone though and myself and my girlfriend had no problems walking around at 3am in the area. They have a huge selection of TV channels (which is great if you don't want to miss your show) and the pool is lovely. The only gripe I would have is that the breakfast is pretty poor. However having said that there are loads of places to eat in the area so no big deal. Overall we really liked it here. So much in fact that we booked in there again for our return to San Francisco a week later.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LiseVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Phoenix for a week and really loved it. Great art in the courtyard, central location, comfortable room with funky decor, interesting clientele (rock bands and families - what a mix!), but more than anything else - a wonderful front office staff. Our daughter was sick while we were there and they put together a "get well kit" including cough candies, vitamin C and a puzzle! We were truly touched by their thoughtfulness. The room rate (including parking!) was great and the food at the Bambuddha Lounge terrific. The lounge can be a bit noisy on Friday and Saturday nights, but they make sure it all shuts down at 11:00 pm precisely! Location in the Tenderloin might not work for everyone, but we felt safe and comfortable there even with little kids in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in the worst nighberhood in S.F- tenderlion. Staying alive there is just a metter of good luck”
Reviews.Author: nophoenixagain
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 night in order to participate in a conference, which held 1 mile from there, in the Intercontinental hotel. The reason for choosing this Hotel was there promise for free wifi and free parking and good breakfast. It does not matter what the hotel is, prices or services. The point is that the hotel is in the hart of the worst neighborhood of San Francisco- named Tenderloin. Drugged peoples, homeless peoples, ugly people, prostitutes ladies and males, drunks are the best there and i am not writing about the bed. For me, as a white regular male, it was just a luck for not murdered!To be in the hotel room is not safe either since the access to the rooms is free and easy! Regarding the hotel itself: it is a old and ugly, wifi do not work regularly, bath are ugly, breakfast starts only in 7:30 which is too late. the rooms are around small pool, there are parties each night, around the pool until 03:00 a.m. starting from noon. there are no amenities at room- no coffemaker, micro or fridge.

Reviews.Title: “No way they should be called the Rock n Roll hotel”
Reviews.Author: KNS76
Reviews.Content: Was EXTREMELY disappointed with the hotel service in regards to handling the noise/leisure of guests. Have stayed with friends many times at hotels for concerts and have never been harassed like we were by the staff and think it's total BS that one room with our friends was fine $200. All guest at the pool on Saturday were down to play some tunes while relaxing poolside, however the management asked that music not be played even though we definitely were not playing it loud and were assured by all present they wanted some music. If you are seeking a friendly rock n roll hotel during either the day, eve or night this is not the place. Was a completely over rated hotel and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual renewed 70's motel with an outstanding personality”
Reviews.Author: bolognaises
Reviews.Content: Well, it was a pleasant experience that we'll keep in our mind and in our soul for long time. We've been travelling around the West Coast from Vancouver to LA with two children 8 and 5, and our 4 nts' stop in SF was fortunately at the Phoenix. We found it really value-for-money worth. Charming, coloured, simple but clean and run by very kind guys giving you helpful tips and smiling suggestions. A small pool for refreshing your late afternoons and relaxing cont-breakfasts under the gazebos. We also had dinner once at the restaurant: it is a lounge poshy/ new age cuisine resto, but we found also good solutions for the kids. Service had been prompt and professional and we had a very good experience with the asian-californian fusion cuisine. The rooms are well furnished and full optional, clean and warmly welcoming you once back from strolling up-and-down SF hills. The location is convenient and downtown (Union Square) is walking distance. The open issue is of course the area surrounding: the "famous" Tender(Loin). I'd say that probably it is just a matter of make you accustomed to see beggars and poor people walking along the streets rather than feel oneself unsafe. We have walked with the children many times to reach downtown without a single episode annoying us. I'd guess that nightime it is probably a litle worse, but if you drive in with your car or if you take a cab there's no way to get involved in a dangerous movie. The hotel is locked and safe. Free parking and free wi-fi connection benefits.

Reviews.Title: “all hype”
Reviews.Author: Joysafina
Reviews.Content: Well....it was a decent hotel/motel. It is basically a remodelled motel 6 style of place with new interior. The room itself was nice enough and very clean. The service was very good too. I guess I was just expectcting a lot more based on the reviews but it did not live up to the hype (or the pictures). Good things: clean, remodeled, fairly reasonably price, decent breakfast, and free parking (!). Not so good things: bar was closed on the night we were there, location, general style of hotel. I'm from SF and you do not want to stay in this area if you have a choice. There are many hotels/motels in SF in better areas for this price or less. Keep searching.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience”
Reviews.Author: jandub62
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Pheonix. It was everything the reviews said. In fact the reviews were the reason we chose to stay there. I have teenage daughters and a ten year old they thought it was so cool. Beware of the surrounding neighborhood and the sirens all night. If you can not tolerate the noise at night you might want to stay some where else. We walked all day in San Francisco so we were tired enough to sleep through the noise. Regardless we felt very safe on the in the hotel and on the hotel grounds. The staff was great and the room was very clean and cute. The hotel is updated and nostalgic at the same time. We are from Texas so air conditioning is a must in the summer. Sleeping with the windows open was awsome. I would definatly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even if the area is not so pleasant..it is so nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Love4travels
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel, nice, clean, good staff, hot water pool ( so nice!!).. Location very close to downtown, bus/subway stops 5-10min walking, continental breakfast included. The only negative thing is that is located in Tenderloin area, so much homelesses walking in the street (Hyde str. specially) but the hotel staff is always glad to help you find the best way to reach your daily destination avoiding the worst streets.. we had no car so for the 2 days we had dinner at the hotel's restaurant.. good food and affordable prices! I recommend it especially for young people because of the "rock&roll" atmosphere ;-)

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE COOLEST HOTELS YOU COULD STAY”
Reviews.Author: jojoryan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pheonix for 4 nights and couldn't have wished for anything better. From the minute we arrived the friendly staff made sure we had everything we needed, from tips on where to which sights to visit, where the best shopping was throu to where we could find a late night cocktail in the neighborhood. The rooms were generous in size, spotless and had a lovely aesthetic overlooking the palm tree court yard and pool. I'm not into overpriced up market hotel and prefer more intimate, boutique hotels and this was one of the coolest places I've stayed... I was visiting SF with my mom and the hotel staff made sure we had a room way from where the pool action takes place and every night was restful and relaxing. (tip - it can be a little on the noisy side until 11pm but who goes to sleep before then?) Everyone was advising us about how dangerous the Tenderloin area is but honestly I'd rather stay there amongst the colorful characters and cheap delicious restaurants then be in a tourist trap any day. Plus it was only a 5 min bus ride into the Civic and a $5 ride to the Mission. Five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay there if you enjoy late nights and party atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: FitnessMama
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the SF marathon and found this hotel on TA - it was in our budget and looked nice on website. What a disaster. The first thing that struck me was the neighborhood. Nearby "skid row" was scary and disturbing, plus no restaurants to walk to. Room was ok - microwave and fridge was nice touch but windows blocked no sound. Needed a good night sleep so went to bed early. Woke up at 11:45pm to the sound of woohoo-ing girls and dance music with mega bass blasting through the hotel. Called down to front desk to complain and attendant said that attached night club that was blasting dance music is not under hotel control but they would ask if they could turn it down. They offered me earplugs too!! Finally club turned down music to tolerable level. but only after more complaints. Left room early in morning and returned after 1:30pm - room wasn't made up and house keeper said she couldn't get to us for a while. Final straw was that there was a party hosted by night club that used pool and patio area from 2-9pm so guests couldn't use grounds. Hotel was not worth the price. We checked out early. Only positive note was that the staff was mostly nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A blast from the past”
Reviews.Content: We were visiting San Francisco with our 16 year old son and wanted to stay somewhere other than at the 'popular' spots like we have done before. We could not have been more pleased with the Phoenix. First of all having FREE parking was very nice. Despite what was expressed regarding the neighborhood, we thought it was fine. (Suggestion: If you are using the BART, walk toward the Library/City Hall and pick it up at Civic Center. It will shorter and safer than waking to Powell St.) The hotel totally made my wife and I think of our travels as kids with our parents. It is a vintage travel lodge style converted into a modern art deco hotel. The room was great, there is a pool, heated and continental breakfast each day. We would definitely stay here again. Once suggestion, request rooms in the back away from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: thirdpyramid
Reviews.Content: I'm a little prejudiced, I met my boyfriend at a party there in 2000. We've stayed again a couple times and this year I was pretty impressed with the extent of the remodels. This year we stayed the weekend for a Pride party on Sunday, and found it was a great place to be centrally located but in an oasis from the madness around Civic Center. We'll probably do it again next year. I've read some of the other reviews about the neighborhood and yes, it is definitely in the thick of it. The interior/exterior contrasts is one of the things I like about it, though, and I happen to like kitschy Vietnamese and Thai restaurants and chatting with the occasional tranny working girl on the way to Union Square. But it's not for everybody. Did I mention the pool is heated?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and confortable green spot into the city”
Reviews.Author: casenuca
Reviews.Content: Ideal for visitig San Francisco. Located very close to the city center. It is a green spot in the city. You fell like being at the Caribbean. Wonderful pool. The personnel is very gentle. Higly recommended. Sebastiano from Italy

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: APBridger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ten days and will happily return. The owner and staff couldn't be more helpful, the room was clean and large. The hotel provided a guide to local restaurants and this was accurate in its descriptions of the restaurants and most were within walking distance of the hotel. THe hotel The description of artistic and funky was accurate. The big disappointments were the breakfast, with a limited range available and the neighbourhood. When I arrived i was given a map that marked out the local area that was a no-go zone. A bit off putting but not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, refreshing, rejuvenating!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleConstance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Phoenix because it is so close to the Civic Center and the Opera House where I went to three operas over three nights. I had a wonderful time. The staff were very helpful and friendly and welcoming. The pool is not only clean and relaxing, but also beautiful decorated with a lovely mosaic. I relaxed in the sun with my new friends, a pair of resident black birds who also liked to relax poolside. I walked to fun restaurants, the Asian Art Museum, the public library (which was having a fantastic book sale), and St. Mary's Cathedral. Took the bus to Haight Ashbury. My room was clean and comfortable (the wooden xylophone was a nice touch!) The complimentary continental breakfast by the pool, soaking in more sun, was a treat! The hotel is in a rough area with street people, but there were always lots of people coming and going and I never felt isolated.

Reviews.Title: “We will only stay at The Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: memorysgone
Reviews.Content: Our very favorite place to stay in San Francisco. Known as the Rock and Roll Hotel, The Phoenix is a true oasis in the middle of the bustling city. This was our second visit to The Phoenix Hotel. My family won't stay anywhere else! What a fun place. What an incredible staff! Especially helpful is front office manager Diana Weech. We had tickets for Wicked on April 30 and, of course, we booked The Phoenix, having had a wonderful time there the previous November. Our 20 year old daughter loves The Phoenix! Yes, The Phoenix is in the Tenderloin, you wouldn't want to go wandering out alone at night but we feel perfectly safe at The Phoenix. Once you enter the private courtyard at The Phoenix, you're in another world! Here's what you get: An incredibly clean, comfortable room, with lovely furnishings, wifi, in-room coffee, as well as a nice complimentary breakfast in the morning AND a very reasonable rate. Add in the superlative assistance at the front desk, a great pool and lounge area with fun statuary around, a relaxed, casual atmosphere, the occasional rock star and you have a recipe for a delightful get-away. And did I mention that there is free, and safe, parking? If you need anything, a simple call to the front desk takes care of it. Staff makes each and every guest feel special and welcome. As a member of the Joy of Life Club, we had a split of Chardonnay waiting for us when we arrived as well as a greeting card from the staff welcoming us to The Phoenix again. We also enjoyed a superb dinner at the Bambuddha prior to our show. They offer a blend of small and large plates and make it easy for a family to enjoy many different dishes. If you enjoy Asian fare, give the Bambuddha a try. You'll be glad you did. We already have another trip to SF planned in July so we'll be back to The Phoenix Hotel! Don't miss this gem on your next visit to San Francisco. We recommend The Phoenix to our friends visiting SF.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: santitam
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem indeed! Old 50's caravan lodge reinvented to a hotspot! I had been to the lounge for drinks and good music before and adored it. This time around we stayed there for a night away from the kids. It has a cool rock n roll edge. There was a band staying while we were there. It is fun to look at, nicely decorated, comfortable and so affordable. We would definately go back. We had no complaints. A few guests were having some late night fun late but I am not put off that, makes the place more fun. Some street noise as this is in a busy area. The neighborhood although not the best was fine, we had no problems and walked around for a drink at Temple Bar around the corner. I really liked the look and feel of this place!

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix is a delight.”
Reviews.Author: carmenveranda
Reviews.Content: I would stay at the Phoenix again. As mentioned in previous reviews, the neighborhood was dicey. My friend, my child and I walked from the end of the street car line, at Market Street to the hotel. No one harassed us or anything, but we were uncomfortable. I volunteer with the homeless, so my inclination is to take people where they are, but I was intimidated. The Phoenix is an oasis. The courtyard is great, the room colorful and clean. I love the ceramic coffee mugs and glass water glasses instead of wretched Styrofoam and plastic cups. I brought my own coffee, because one never knows, but the coffee was not the usual bad tasting stuff found in most hotel rooms. We were only there one night, but I would definitely come back to the Phoenix. Luke and Matt at the front desk were helpful, bright and cheerful. Breakfast was fresh and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Zainaba
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and our brief stay there. We would definitely come back. The courtyard is beautiful and inviting, with birds, flowers and a tropical appeal. The staff were amazingly helpful and took a genuine interest in their guests. The rooms were comfortable and well-appointed. Breakfast, sitting in the courtyard, was also great. I especially loved that this hotel did not feel like a chain and felt unexpected and personal. The parking was convenient. Although I was warned not to walk down Eddy St., we did walk toward the Civic Center and felt entirely comfortable. From there it was easy to catch a bus and explore the city. Lastly, on our way out of the city, the young woman at the front desk suggested a detour to drive down the crookedest street, which we did and enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel! Has everything we look for...”
Reviews.Author: cadvan
Reviews.Content: After staying in many San Francisco hotels,we finally found the one we would return to again & again. Eco-friendly,customer friendly,car friendly. Everything we want when we travel for business & need to relax afterwards. Free parking, a nice bar,restaurant,pool,peaceful surroundings & extra helpful staff. Even the neighborhood doesn't put us off. Good restaurants-especially Vietnamese nearby.We love it here.Rock & Roll atmosphere without the TV's being thrown out the windows! If only they had rock & roll in the Bambuddha Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: meoddity
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here within the last 2 weeks. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, and our private balcony was a nice thing to have too. Although it was a little scary in the area surrounding the hotel at night, daytime was much better...The courtyard is peaceful and overflowing with plants and art. The hospitality at the front desk was amazing as well....I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Got to get back!”
Reviews.Author: tintinScotland
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is the best hotel in California! I have stayed there pretty much every time I have been to San Francisco. There is nowhere else like it. Cool 1950's vibe, great pool, great staff, lots of cool music dudes. They are doing the rooms up so lets hope it does not loose any of it's retro chic character. The Tenderloin is a dodgy area, but not as bad as it used to be!

Reviews.Title: “scary location”
Reviews.Author: kayakercat
Reviews.Content: this was an OK place to stay. While the location was somewhat convenient this hotel was in a scary neighborhood- not a place you want to be walking alone at night . The rooms were average, not the cleanest place....

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gmc80
Reviews.Content: After walking down Eddy Street, which has to be said was a pretty intimadating road, I was feeling a bit concerned that I had not listened to a friend's protests that the tenderlion was not the area to stay in San Fran. Overall however we were happy with the Phoenix, although I have to admit that I don't think it is as cool as it would like to be, or perhaps used to be. The rooms were huge, particularly for the price and the hotel was excellent value. They had the funky motel vibe down to a tee. The bambudda lounge, which I had heard great things about was not as fab as I would have hoped, and I was surprised that the music was quite R&B (However we did visit on a Saturday night, which perhaps is the only night this type of music is played) The staff on reception were all really friendly particularly Luke and were the coolest thing about the hotel. Although some of the surrounding streets were not so desirable the phoenix was well placed for visiting all of the cities areas of interest such as the mission, castro, alamo square, as well as the more obvious city centre sites. If this hotel was not next to such a rough part of Eddy St it would have been perfect, but then I am sure it would have been twice the price!

Reviews.Title: “Rock & Roll Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockknRollBob
Reviews.Content: This Is without a doubt the greatest botique hotel in the country and I've been to them all. for the last 20 years I have been touring with bands and every time we go to San Francisco we stay at the Phoenix. I'd say I've stayed there 10 times. It's very chick and a great location (5 minutes from Market St., 5 minutes from mitchell brother :-) ) Grade A party palace!. I always look forward to a fews days at the Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a night at the Phoenix. We were there for a party at the Bambuddha Lounge, a great night spot adjacent to the hotel. The decor is what you see in the pictures: a funky revitalization of a 50's style motel. Our room was basic but quite clean and comfortable. There was a faint odor of cigarette smoke, even though it was supposedly non-smoking -- but it was faint enough not to bother us (our friends were initially assigned a much smokier-smelling room, but they asked to be switched and were accommodated). The front-desk staff was generally attentive and polite -- especially the night clerk, Luke. We were mostly surprised by what a great deal it was. We paid $133 with our AAA discount, including on-site parking and continental breakfast. Usually when breakfast is included at places like this, you're lucky to get coffee and doughnuts. Although not lavish, this one still exceeded my expectations: laid out buffet-style by the pool, it included coffee, several types of milk (soy, skim, whole, and half-and-half), OJ, several types of pastries (muffins, croissants, danishes, raisin bread), bagels with cream cheese (you could toast them if you liked), and whole fruit. The only major downside is the neighborhood (the Tenderloin), which is down-and-out. Then again, since your car is parked right there with complete in-and-out access, you don't need to walk around. Although you should make an exception and head to Brenda's French Soul Food, around the corner, for what might be the most delicious brunch you'll ever have. Overall, I would recommend the Phoenix for the value-conscious who appreciate funky style.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Phoenix Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmynich
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Phoenix many times and love the location and the atmosphere. The Bambudda lounge is a great place for dinner. The staff are hip, cool and the outdoor space rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Cool concept, but noisy & cold--with hotel restaurant that was closed!”
Reviews.Author: atteoj
Reviews.Content: I was only here for two nights, and I wanted to check it out knowing full-well it was in the Tenderloin and wasn't anything fancy. I was OK with the sketchy neighborhood because I'd be out in meetings all day and really just wanted to see the concept. They've done a great job with updating the motor-inn while keeping it true to the essence. My complaints are really rather simple: 1. The restaurant/bar is not open on Sunday-Tuesday--which is when I stayed here. Normally not a problem in the city, but I can't exactly go walking around this neighborhood at night to explore! 2. The room is not well-insulated, because of the windows, so it was pretty cold at night and the only heater is an ancient wall heater down in the corner by one of the beds. I had to take the blankets from both beds and put them over me to be comfortable. 3. The bedspreads smelled pretty musty. I took them off right away, but they seem like they could use a good airing out. 4. This is a complaint I have of many hotels. Though they say they won't replace your towels if you hang them back up, they do! This is annoying because I've held up my end of the bargain and they just ignore it and waste all that water.

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Dutch2by2
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with awesome staff and amenities that made me feel like a rock star. Room was nice and bathroom was new. Plenty of parking, monitored 24 hours, in front of hotel. I came to see a favorite band at a local venue and the cab ride was cheap. I spotted several band members at the pool area the next morning having breakfast - very cool. It's definitely the best place to stay in SF and I look forward to my next rock-star stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix is special”
Reviews.Author: Murphtv
Reviews.Content: We loved the 50's Motel style thing they have going on. I've toured with a few large bands over the years, so I felt right at home at the Phoenix while we played spot the roadie and stuffed our faces on the "backstage" style breakfast catering. Beautiful heated pool and very chilled (in a good way) staff. Yes the area is "gritty" but you are warned and if your careful it is an experience you'll never forget. Just avoid Ellis st if you are easily shocked. San Fran is a great town, to much for little old me to review. Just go.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than the reviews led me to believe!”
Reviews.Author: acantharia
Reviews.Content: The staff was so helpful and friendly, even at midnight and 5 AM. The decor was fun and funky, the rooms and bathrooms clean, and the complimentary outdoor breakfast fantastic (croissants, muffins, pastries, fruit, juice, coffee and tea and real plates and utensils). After reading the reviews here, I was unnecessarily worried that I was signing up for a bad neighborhood and a barely clean room, but I didn't want to pay more for a nicer hotel. I was happily surprised at how wrong I was. The rooms and courtyard were clean and cute (and included a locked gate). There were some loiterers in the surrounding blocks, but as I dragged my suitcase past them after my midnight flight arrival, they didn't try to interact with me at all- not to panhandle, not to talk- really they just ignored me. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the Phoeix”
Reviews.Author: tmz_ct
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Phoenix Hotel. This is a good hotel for those looking for something out of the ordinary and fun. It was nice to find a place full of color and not just your average bland, beige hotel. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Complimentary breakfast and parking were a plus. Overall had a great experience here and hope that you do, too.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the Tenderloin”
Reviews.Author: mooksdukes
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix lived up to most of the reviews posted on this site....the good, the bad and the ugly. The good being the great staff and clean comfortable rooms...with a complimentary continentalbreakfast to boot!..the bad..as much as hotel policy tries to controlnoise levels within the grounds of the hotel..it's hard to get guests to chill out and be quiet after bar hopping or partying..and then gain you really aren't aware of how easily the sound travels until you are in your room and hear others in party mode. ...the ugly..well is the "hood"...which you nor the hotel has any control over...it's the reality of the Tenderloin...Remember that at the end of your visit you get to go back to your comfy home environment...you can leave all that behind...yet for the citizens of the "hood" the streets, parks and sidewalks are their home. If you happen to be in the hood on a Sunday..walk over to the Glide Ministry on Ellis and attend one of their services at 9 or 11 am...you'll walk out with a big smile.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: LillySaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I recommend the hotel for couples or families that search cost / benefit. The hotel offers free parking and the breakfast also included surprised for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix hotel : fun and affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pat_from_Liege
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Phoenix . The staff was very helpfull and kind. We had no problem of noise late at night. The room was really nice and clean. The courtyard with the heated swimming pool is a big (funny and funky) plus, as the very convenient parking. The ambience is really cool. We were a bit surprised by the neighborhood (we didn't know !) on the first morning, but after that we managed to get taxi cabs, or navigate around with no problem. When we'll go back to SF, it' ll be at the Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: MSRNC
Reviews.Content: I love the Phoenix and have stayed there several times. The staff is always very attentive and the heated pool and patio area is a lot of fun. But, they do a good job of keeping the noise down late at night. The ambience and decor carry much more character than most other hotels. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix: Fun, Funky, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: MaybeNextYear
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family trip to San Francisco. Our three boys loved the hotel, especially the funky courtyard and the swimming pool. The staff is very helpful. The rooms are a nice size, and the bathrooms have nice fixtures for the price of the room. Yes, the hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin, which can be sketchy, but it is quite easy to navigate around the worst of it. The neighborhood is also getting better. Several Asian restaurants have opened within a few blocks, and they are affordable and authentic. If you are looking for a quiet, sanitized hotel, the Phoenix is not for you. But if you want a friendly, affordable, and funky place to stay in San Francisco it is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix is Fun and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Frent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Phoenix some ten times in the past four years, with and without our kids. We like its quirky, clean rooms, friendly employees, and proximity to our favorite restaurants and live music venues. The neighborhood is indeed sketchy, but we never have problems getting taxi cabs, either through the front desk or by simply standing on the corner outside the hotel. The parking is a convenient bonus - right in front of the hotel where it should be.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever”
Reviews.Author: dumbowl08
Reviews.Content: The hotel had my suv impounded which cost me $285 and inconvience that spoiled my San Fran experience! The staff was very rude and didn't care that they ruined all of my guests night and put me in a financial hardship.

Reviews.Title: “The Surprising Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: DGMSeattle
Reviews.Content: A friend had found the hotel on-line, sent us a link, and we said "Sure, looks OK". I did not pay the close attention to neighborhood that I would have if I had done the research. So, I was quite dismayed as we neared SF and I realized the hotel was in the Tenderloin, based on what I knew from living in the Bay area decades earlier. I was still doubtful as we pulled up and saw the street side presentation. BUT, peeking through the gate into the courtyard, I felt a bit better. Then we walked up to the desk and were greeted by two of the most genuinely friendly people I have ever encountered in the hospitality business. That characteristic was true of all other encounters with staff. The ambience is funky with interesting metal sculptures and burbling fountains. The rooms were clean. Furnishings were eclectic. Our bathroom was sparkling clean. Looked like new tile work. The included poolside, covered, under the heat lamp breakfast was very good for what it was. Good pastries, bagels, breads, surprisingly good coffee, juices. Just short on protein. Excellent, inexpensive restaurants nearby. Ask the staff. And, the neighborhood, while definitely big city gritty, never felt dangerous. Two minor quibbles: First, the jalousie windows didn't close tightly enough to stop a strong, cool exterior breeze from blowing into the room. But, the wall heater compensated (at some environmental cost). Second, either don't drive to the hotel or park your car once and take transit. Getting in and out of parking spaces there can be challenging.) But, definitely a great experience overall. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “like it a lot”
Reviews.Author: Andy1951
Reviews.Content: Fun place. Great location in downtown SF near Opera house and other musical venues. Many musicians stay here. Stayed for 4 days and met people from many parts of the world. A lot of young people some with families and a few oldies interspersed. Great pool scene every night and many people in the pool right up until 11 PM when it closes. The pool is heated to about 85 degrees all the time. Rooms are nice and functional. Staff is cool and relaxed like you would expect in SF. Great free breakfast every morning by the pool.. Our expectations were surpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kjartman
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed with my stay at the Phoenix Hotel. The staff was great and the rooms were okay, tho slightly old and worn down. However... breakfast was simple and the neighborhood .. or "da hood"... was very bad. Walking along Eddy street to Union Square you'll come across quite a few "interesting" characters. Homeless people, pimps, prostitutes, beggars, criminals and other shady individuals. Phoenix hotel lives well on the cult status from having been visited by alot of famous rock musicians and the likes, but beyond that, it doesn't deserve its high ranking on this website. That`s my opinion at least. Situated in another area of SF, this could be a winner, but its not. Will not come again.

Reviews.Title: “A stay with a difference”
Reviews.Author: IainAF
Reviews.Content: To be completely fair, I will start with the negatives: The the hotel is in the area described by Orbitz as 'Union Square/Knob Hill' and better described as 'Tenderloin' - a more deprived area. The hotel gardens could do with a slight make-over so the art sculptures don't look like discarded scrap. Some guests can be a little inconsiderate and despite the best efforts of the staff, can be noisy (well) after midnight. Now the better bits: Friendly, informal and helpful check-in. Good-sized rooms; very clean and comfortable. The pool and patio area are clean. Breakfast of fruitjuice, bread, butter, jam (jelly), sweet pastries/cake, fresh fruit and acceptable coffee. The restaurant attached to the hotel is the Bambuddah Lounge which has a happy (2) hour(s) for cocktails which are competently mixed by the barstaff at half price - excellent value, and good even at full price. The menu is an asian-mediterranean fusion and quite interesting, enjoyable, tasty and well-presented. If going out at night, reception are happy to call you a cab. In summary, we enjoyed our two nights at the Phoenix and would recommend it as a city break 3 Star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Personality”
Reviews.Author: oddtree
Reviews.Content: This was a very fun hotel with a great bar and pool. All of the rooms faced onto the pool courtyard. We walked down to dinner at Farmer Brown's (great mint juleps), but if you're worried about the neighborhood you can always cab it. It was also a short walk to the Civic Center area.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: natashabray
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is a really awesome hotel! The rooms are super clean and the whole staff's service is really amazing. They really treat you like you are special. The location is great, right in the center of everything so you can get around really easily. Its a really cool vibe and a lot of rockers have stayed there so it has awesome character. I and never hate on free breakfast in the morning. Whenever I come to San Francisco, I always stay at the Phoenix. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: CaroVancouver
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Phoenix Hotel and enjoyed the property very much. It's in a grittier part of town but that did not bother us. We enjoyed some great food and evenings out in the Tenderloin. It was a little louder at night, but I had earplugs! If you're looking for quiet, this isn't the place for you. The hotel itself was clean, very funky, and the staff were very attentive and helpful. The Bambuddha Lounge is great, and the food is good. Overall, if you're looking for a nice hotel out of the tourist trap of Union Square, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A True Experience”
Reviews.Author: RicaToronto
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel in a city full of experiences like San Francisco, you want something that is going to be as memorable and special as the rest of your experience - the Phoenix Hotel is this. On a recent trip I stayed here and then at another hotel near Union Square and there was no comparison. The Phoenix hotel offered MUCH more than it's 2 stars lets on. The rooms were spacious, clean and had everything you needed. The free continental breakfast was awesome - great coffee, food and ambiance. So the basics are completely covered. Where this hotel delivers above and beyond is what other hotels can't - wicked vibe, surroundings and service. The pool area is an awesome place to just sit and hang out - the guests also tend to be friendly and social which makes for a great experience. What more can you ask for - sitting at a pool with a martini in hand, reading a book or online with the free wifi. The restaurant offers fantastic food and drink which doesn't hurt! Staff service is also great - the front desk will go out of their way to get you what you need even when you don't expect it. Yes, the immediate area leaves a little to be desired but it's located in a very central place close to all major bus lines and sights. Union square isn't any better in my opinion - downtown tends to be a bit sketch in general. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Klayer
Reviews.Content: Headed to SF for a 40th Birthday Celebration - and wanted it to be a memorable trip - staying at the Phoenix Hotel - just added to the Uniqueness. We did make our reservations because of the recommendations on Trip Advisor - and we were not dissapointed. The staff at the Front Desk - were ALL amazing and very helpful. If what you seek is a place like no other - then this is a great place for you. The staff at the club was also Wonderful - and will certainly stay there on the next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Staying at the Phoenix !!!”
Reviews.Author: JMJones
Reviews.Content: First, The Phoenix has free parking - too rare in San Francisco, but adds value for the traveler! Second, as a member of their affinity club, "joie de vivre", I was emailed an offer of a great rate or $97US for a Superior King room. The room was fresh, clean and comfortable. They've done an excellent job with their upgrades and renovations. The welcome at check-in was warm and genuine. And all staff shifts were friendly folks.The courtyard and pool area were verdant and inviting. And breakfast was well laid out with good variety and the nearby heaters took the morning chill off. You can see from my pics of construction going on nearby - early morning evidence of dynamic SF. Only concern was the free (again not common enough in SF and a nice plus here) wireless internet was not working and was to be fixed the next day. Interestingly, a British Member of Parliment first told me of this hotel. Until then, it was unknown to me. He said this was the only place his old journalist friends would stay - and he felt the same way!

Reviews.Title: “Will always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Boston_Molly_23
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here during our first real vacation in over 4 years. We are both pretty bohemian and didn't want a touristy or business oriented hotel, nor did we want to stay somewhere low end. The Phoenix was perfect for us. Very relaxed atmosphere where we felt cared for but not imposed upon. Yes, they are currently renovating their bathrooms. However, we got a nice letter informing us of this at the beginning of our stay and an advance call as promised the one day (out of 8) that they had to turn our water off. We just went for a swim and our water was back on by the time we were. An absolutely fabulous oasis in the middle of San Francisco. The heated pool and hip courtyard gave the place a touch of what is great about L.A. without any of L.A.'s numerous downsides. Room was clean, comfortable and relatively spacious. Anything that wasn't readily available was immediately provided by the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: cooksin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Phoenix because we attended a concert at the Great American Music Hall which was walking distance and only minutes away. Having never stayed there before, I was a bit leary when we pulled in the parking lot. Once we were checked in, we entered the courtyard through the gate and were pleasantly surprised. There was a lot of eye candy right away with art sculptures, a great (heated) pool and tropical decor. Our room was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful with thier knowlege of the nieghborhood. Lots of Thai places to eat at on the way to the theater so we found a good restaurant with friendly employees. At the end of the night, we walked back to our room and got a good night of sleep in the king bed -- very comfy! We had cable too and got to watch an A's game before going out. We will definitely go back! Free parking too!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, awful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PinkMartini80
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading some of the rave reviews on Tripadvisor... huge mistake. Although the Phoenix is a decent hotel within walking distance from Powell street (cable car stop), it is situated in one of the most "colourful" neighborhoods I've ever seen. If you are used to the sad sight of countless homeless and drug-addicts, then I guess you will find this place acceptable. I did not. Most of them are harmless, unfortunate people, but I felt extremely unconfortable walking these streets in the evening... or even during day time.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travellingtao
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Phoenix Hotel. The room decorations were very hip and comfortable. Our room had a nice view of the lovely courtyard and pool. We took advantage of specials, such as the day pass to Kabuki Springs Baths and a reduced rate at a gym nearby. Mostly, though, it's the staff that makes this a neat place to stay. Helpful, informed, and just nice people. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: claytone
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. The hotel was very funky and a bit shabby. They appear to be doing work both in the rooms and outside. Best bits - staff very friendly and helpful. Good price. Location handy to most things. (Taxis are cheap anyway). Great bar attached, would have eaten there if it had been open on the Sunday night. Worst bits - noisy next-door neighbours (we could have complained, but chose not to) then construction across the road woke us as 7.30am on Monday morning. The shower leaked, and therefore had about 8 different spray direction. Overall - good price, great potential, great staff. Not as restful as we had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Db0y
Reviews.Content: Although it’s in a dodgy area, The Phoenix is something of a haven away from the street. It’s a courtyard motel style setup, and the atmosphere is laid back and helpful. All the staff were excellent, particularly reception and the bar. The continental breakfast is good. The downsides are a) the area. b) the noise (I have never heard so many sirens) and c) the room sound insulation, or rather lack of it. On balance, I found the phoenix a fun and pleasant place to stay for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find, Loved the Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: 1Maggie
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel in a very centrally located San Francisco neighborhood. Yes, its on the edge of the Tenderloin but a short walk down Larkin gets you to Hayes Street. Hang a right and you wind up in Hayes Valley with shopping, art, great restaurants etc. If you like walking continue from Hayes Valley on to the Haight and have a beer at Magnolia's Brewpub (Haight & Masonic). The Phoenix is a reincarnation of the Caravan Motel/Motor Lodge. Cool vintage feel, fun art all around the pool and terrific staff. The Joie de Vivre "chain" is hugely customer oriented and folks at the Phoenix really standout in that regard. We strongly recommend this as a cool getaway spot in The City. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip Place”
Reviews.Author: jhsst18
Reviews.Content: I found this place using TripAdvisor, and wasn't expecting too much. But this place has amazing character and was fun to stay in. The rooms were so-so - nothing great, but they were clean and served its purpose. But the courtyard area was very hip, and the front-desk folks were very friendly. The lounge was closed when we were there (it was a Sunday), but late night they turned on the heat-lamps for me and my friends so we could hang out, which was great. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a cool, hip place with lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Rock and roll motel”
Reviews.Author: tomthub
Reviews.Content: Really friendly, down-to-earth hotel populated by rock'n'roll wannabes and - if you believe the hype - real stars too. Not when we where there, but no matter - spacious and comfortable room overlooking a delightful swimming pool with lucious plants and faux-Thai bamboo furniture. We managed a swim, despite being January in San Fran, because the pool is heated and a short scamper from any room (they all overlook the courtyard). Al Fresco breakfast is included in the very reasonable price. The restaurant/bar is nice, too, although freeezing despite the open fire. Probably more a summer spot. Only potential problem is noise- Friday night the bar is open outside until 11pm and the walls are a little thin between the rooms, too. But a real personality hotel nonetheless, heartily recommended for the young - or young at heart.

Reviews.Title: “No place quite like it!”
Reviews.Author: CBo1979
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the Phoenix, I must admit to having reservations. We arrived late at night after a bumpy plane ride, an even bumpier taxi journey and the realisation that my partner had left all of his laptop gear in the cab (we got it back though). The area looked mean, and we were dismayed at how thin the walls were. However, come the morning and things seemed a lot brighter. the rooms are very big, the bed comfy, and the courtyard supremely funky. It was without a doubt the coolest place I have ever stayed. However, cool does not always guarantee a good night's sleep and on our third night, we weren't quite drunk enough to block out the all-night pool party taking place. We had an early plane to catch so it wasn't ideal! But if you don't mind a bit of noise and plan to party a lot in SF, then this is THE place to stay. No doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: getmeoutttahere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights 12/31 and 1/1/8. We were greeted by friendly and knowlegable staff who were able to direct us to a local Thai eatery. They allowed us early access to our room. One of the biggest perks with staying here is that there is FREE parking and it is centrally located. We were attending a concert three blocks away. Once we parked at the hotel we did not get back into our car until we left on the 2nd. It's several blocks to the trolley line which took us to the wharf. We then hoofed our way around the city (Chinatown) and back to the hotel. The rooms are pleasantly decorated, spacious and very clean. We loved the grounds. I didn't feel like I was in a city at all, once you enter the pool area through a secure gate (also 24 hr staff on duty). There, art and greenery abounds. We did not go in the pool (too cold) but many guest did during our stay. They don't call it the "rock and roll hotel" for nothing. Although the staff would not indulge me regarding any famous current guests, we did meet someone very famous while enjoying our morning breakfast. Served poolside, it is the best contental breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. The coffee was outstanding and there were fresh bagels and baked goods as well. Some fresh fruit would have been nice, though. Other than that, I can't think of anything that could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “The Pheonix Rocks !”
Reviews.Author: ladycrane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great !!, the staff are very friendly and helpful with giving restaurant recommendations and directions. We stayed for New Years, yeah it was loud but we did not mind as the noise was coming from the band that we saw play !! , the pheonix still delivers as a rock hotel. The other nights we stayed it was quite (no more band), you could hear a little street noise, something we were used to from living in the city. Beds were comfy and we fell right to sleep. Don't worry about the neighborhood, just be street smart, the Tenderloin has the largest growing number of family's in San Fran since housing there is not outrgaeous. The staff gave us great directions as to avoid the not so pretty streets and we walked everywhere and at all times of the day/night, there is always people around of all walks of life. We really enjoyed the cheap and very tasty Vietnamese food restaurants around (try Pagolac and Mangosteen both on Larkin) Free breakfast was not amazing by any means, standard fare, bake goods, bagels and apples & Oranges. Coffee was decent. All in all a great experience and very central location, 4 blocks to the BART and walking distance to everything (if you like to walk).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing CA feeling”
Reviews.Author: MissCA_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: Phoenix is great. The neighborhood is NOT dangerous--it has a 'downtown' feel and if you are staying in the front section there is a little street noise, but there are no projects here, which in my opinion are what make SF neighborhoods dangerous. If you have any sense of culinary curiosity, you will appreciate the many Vietnamese, Thai, Indonesian and even a few Japanese restaurants around here. Staff was nice, rooms are spacious, clean, cute, fun, pool is heated, balconies are awesome! But there is a certain je ne sais quoi, a certain relaxing vibe here that is the heart of what makes the Phoenix great. I can't wait to stay again, hopefully in spring or summer. My only complaint was that when i was there, admittedly during freakishly cold weather, the room heater wasn't quite powerful enough to warm the whole room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lslovessf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Phoenix about 4-5 times over the past year. Each stay has been with my boyfriend for a romantic getaway. We are not impressed with "fancy" hotels- we like places with personality and unexpected qualities. and The location is at first intimidating, but is really harmless, We have discovered a few amazing restaurants within a 2 block radius of the Phoenix. It is a great place to stay for concerts, clubs, just relaxing. The pool is beautiful, the breakfast is great. The staff is always so nice and friendly, too. The rooms are quiet, clean, safe and really inviting. The price is great, too. I have had some great memories at the Phoenix. I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: griffinn
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel recently. I have lived in SF for years and wanted to stay but since I moved away I was able to. This hotel is very funky and fun. The staff are very cool, nice and knowledgeable. The price is about average for SF and the renovated rooms are very comfortable. This is especially a good place for people into live music (many bands stay here) and want a true San Francisco experience. It's close to all the things most people want and even have a map to the best live music venues. Just ask the staff for any help and they will oblige. If you are looking for a fancy, overpriced hotel, this is not the place for you. It is very comfortable, the continental breakfast is good, people seemed to be enjoying the heated pool...it was 48 degrees outside so we passed on that but there were people still partaking. I've heard that the restaurant and nightclub is very good altho we had just danced our "*&^es" off at the Warfield so we were quite beat. All I can say if you want a fun experience, give the Phoenix Hotel a try...it is a better choice for those young or young at heart!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluewoman
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix Hotel is Great and the Staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and the courtyard is ideal for hanging out with friends and just relaxing. I was a bit worried about the comments on the surrounding neighborhood because I was bringing teenagers along but we walked all around the surrounding neighborhood and used public transportation all around the city without any problems even at night. We talked to a bunch of the street people in the area and never once did we feel threatened. We walked to and from the Warfield on Market St for a concert at night and it was not an issue. The hotel is in an ideal location for all public transportation including BART and most buses and we went all over the city from the hotel. We did catch a cab a couple times and the front office called one for us and they were at the door in 2 mins very helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Hotel rocked!”
Reviews.Author: danted23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Civic Center BART stop so it's quite easy to get to. Upon our arrival we quickly checked in and had dinner at The Bambuddha Lounge. The food/service was great. Very affordable too. Afterwards we stepped in to the Lounge area where a DJ was spinning tunes. Our room was very clean and tidy. Every morning there was a continental breakfast that was very tasty. The front desk was very helpful and would have a cab out front for us within 5 minutes when we needed one. Kudos to everyone at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffykitten07
Reviews.Content: A bright light in a dark place. This hotel is very cool. Friendly and helpful staff. A great courtyard with twinkly lights and a pool where you can sit and relax to some chilled out tunes. A great place to hang out with friends and an excellent restaurant and bar. Great food.
